Multiband Compress or expand the audio’s dynamic range.
The input audio is divided into bands using 4th order Linkwitz-Riley IIRs. This is akin to the crossover of a loudspeaker, and results in flat frequency response when absent compander action.
It accepts the following parameters:
name: mcompand

parameters.name: args
description: This option syntax is: attack,decay,[attack,decay..] soft-knee points crossover_frequency [delay [initial_volume [gain]]] | attack,decay ... For explanation of each item refer to compand filter documentation.
Mix channels with specific gain levels. The filter accepts the output channel layout followed by a set of channels definitions.
This filter is also designed to efficiently remap the channels of an audio stream.
The filter accepts parameters of the form: "
l|outdef|outdef|..."
name: pan

parameters.name: l
description: output channel layout or number of channels

parameters.name: outdef
description: output channel specification, of the form: "
out_name=[gain*]in_name[(+-)[gain*]in_name...]"

parameters.name: out_name
description: output channel to define, either a channel name (FL, FR, etc.) or a channel number (c0, c1, etc.)

parameters.name: gain
description: multiplicative coefficient for the channel, 1 leaving the volume unchanged

parameters.name: in_name
description: input channel to use, see out_name for details; it is not possible to mix named and numbered input channels
ReplayGain scanner filter. This filter takes an audio stream as an input and outputs it unchanged. At end of filtering it displays track_gain and track_peak.
name: replaygain

description: Convert the audio sample format, sample rate and channel layout. It is not meant to be used directly.
name: resample

description: Apply time-stretching and pitch-shifting with librubberband.
To enable compilation of this filter, you need to configure FFmpeg with
--enable-librubberband.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: rubberband

parameters.name: tempo
description: Set tempo scale factor.

parameters.name: pitch
description: Set pitch scale factor.

parameters.name: transients
description: Set transients detector. Possible values are:
crisp
mixed
smooth

parameters.name: detector
description: Set detector. Possible values are:
compound
percussive
soft

parameters.name: phase
description: Set phase. Possible values are:
laminar
independent

parameters.name: window
description: Set processing window size. Possible values are:
standard
short
long

parameters.name: smoothing
description: Set smoothing. Possible values are:
off
on

parameters.name: formant
description: Enable formant preservation when shift pitching. Possible values are:
shifted
preserved

parameters.name: pitchq
description: Set pitch quality. Possible values are:
quality
speed
consistency

parameters.name: channels
description: Set channels. Possible values are:
apart
together

This filter acts like normal compressor but has the ability to compress detected signal using second input signal. It needs two input streams and returns one output stream. First input stream will be processed depending on second stream signal. The filtered signal then can be filtered with other filters in later stages of processing. See pan and amerge filter.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: sidechaincompress

parameters.name: level_in
description: Set input gain. Default is 1. Range is between 0.015625 and 64.

parameters.name: mode
description: Set mode of compressor operation. Can be upward or downward. Default is downward.

parameters.name: threshold
description: If a signal of second stream raises above this level it will affect the gain reduction of first stream. By default is 0.125. Range is between 0.00097563 and 1.

parameters.name: ratio
description: Set a ratio about which the signal is reduced. 1:2 means that if the level raised 4dB above the threshold, it will be only 2dB above after the reduction. Default is 2. Range is between 1 and 20.

parameters.name: attack
description: Amount of milliseconds the signal has to rise above the threshold before gain reduction starts. Default is 20. Range is between 0.01 and 2000.

parameters.name: release
description: Amount of milliseconds the signal has to fall below the threshold before reduction is decreased again. Default is 250. Range is between 0.01 and 9000.

parameters.name: makeup
description: Set the amount by how much signal will be amplified after processing. Default is 1. Range is from 1 to 64.

parameters.name: knee
description: Curve the sharp knee around the threshold to enter gain reduction more softly. Default is 2.82843. Range is between 1 and 8.

parameters.name: link
description: Choose if the average level between all channels of side-chain stream or the louder(maximum) channel of side-chain stream affects the reduction. Default is average.

parameters.name: detection
description: Should the exact signal be taken in case of peak or an RMS one in case of rms. Default is rms which is mainly smoother.

parameters.name: level_sc
description: Set sidechain gain. Default is 1. Range is between 0.015625 and 64.

parameters.name: mix
description: How much to use compressed signal in output. Default is 1. Range is between 0 and 1.

A sidechain gate acts like a normal (wideband) gate but has the ability to filter the detected signal before sending it to the gain reduction stage. Normally a gate uses the full range signal to detect a level above the threshold. For example: If you cut all lower frequencies from your sidechain signal the gate will decrease the volume of your track only if not enough highs appear. With this technique you are able to reduce the resonation of a natural drum or remove "rumbling" of muted strokes from a heavily distorted guitar. It needs two input streams and returns one output stream. First input stream will be processed depending on second stream signal.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: sidechaingate

parameters.name: level_in
description: Set input level before filtering. Default is 1. Allowed range is from 0.015625 to 64.

parameters.name: mode
description: Set the mode of operation. Can be upward or downward. Default is downward. If set to upward mode, higher parts of signal will be amplified, expanding dynamic range in upward direction. Otherwise, in case of downward lower parts of signal will be reduced.

parameters.name: range
description: Set the level of gain reduction when the signal is below the threshold. Default is 0.06125. Allowed range is from 0 to 1. Setting this to 0 disables reduction and then filter behaves like expander.

parameters.name: threshold
description: If a signal rises above this level the gain reduction is released. Default is 0.125. Allowed range is from 0 to 1.

parameters.name: ratio
description: Set a ratio about which the signal is reduced. Default is 2. Allowed range is from 1 to 9000.

parameters.name: attack
description: Amount of milliseconds the signal has to rise above the threshold before gain reduction stops. Default is 20 milliseconds. Allowed range is from 0.01 to 9000.

parameters.name: release
description: Amount of milliseconds the signal has to fall below the threshold before the reduction is increased again. Default is 250 milliseconds. Allowed range is from 0.01 to 9000.

parameters.name: makeup
description: Set amount of amplification of signal after processing. Default is 1. Allowed range is from 1 to 64.

parameters.name: knee
description: Curve the sharp knee around the threshold to enter gain reduction more softly. Default is 2.828427125. Allowed range is from 1 to 8.

parameters.name: detection
description: Choose if exact signal should be taken for detection or an RMS like one. Default is rms. Can be peak or rms.

parameters.name: link
description: Choose if the average level between all channels or the louder channel affects the reduction. Default is average. Can be average or maximum.

parameters.name: level_sc
description: Set sidechain gain. Default is 1. Range is from 0.015625 to 64.
Detect silence in an audio stream.
This filter logs a message when it detects that the input audio volume is less or equal to a noise tolerance value for a duration greater or equal to the minimum detected noise duration.
The printed times and duration are expressed in seconds. The

lavfi.silence_start or lavfi.silence_start.X metadata key is set on the first frame whose timestamp equals or exceeds the detection duration and it contains the timestamp of the first frame of the silence.

The lavfi.silence_duration or lavfi.silence_duration.X and lavfi.silence_end or lavfi.silence_end.X metadata keys are set on the first frame after the silence. If mono is enabled, and each channel is evaluated separately, the .X suffixed keys are used, and X corresponds to the channel number.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: silencedetect

parameters.name: noise
description: Set noise tolerance. Can be specified in dB (in case "dB" is appended to the specified value) or amplitude ratio. Default is -60dB, or 0.001.

parameters.name: duration
description: Set silence duration until notification (default is 2 seconds). See
(ffmpeg-utils)the Time duration section in the ffmpeg-utils(1) manual for the accepted syntax.

parameters.name: mono
description: Process each channel separately, instead of combined. By default is disabled.
Remove silence from the beginning, middle or end of the audio.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: silenceremove

parameters.name: start_periods
description: This value is used to indicate if audio should be trimmed at beginning of the audio. A value of zero indicates no silence should be trimmed from the beginning. When specifying a non-zero value, it trims audio up until it finds non-silence. Normally, when trimming silence from beginning of audio the start_periods will be 1 but it can be increased to higher values to trim all audio up to specific count of non-silence periods. Default value is 0.

parameters.name: start_duration
description: Specify the amount of time that non-silence must be detected before it stops trimming audio. By increasing the duration, bursts of noises can be treated as silence and trimmed off. Default value is 0.

parameters.name: start_threshold
description: This indicates what sample value should be treated as silence. For digital audio, a value of 0 may be fine but for audio recorded from analog, you may wish to increase the value to account for background noise. Can be specified in dB (in case "dB" is appended to the specified value) or amplitude ratio. Default value is 0.

parameters.name: start_silence
description: Specify max duration of silence at beginning that will be kept after trimming. Default is 0, which is equal to trimming all samples detected as silence.

parameters.name: start_mode
description: Specify mode of detection of silence end in start of multi-channel audio. Can be any or all. Default is any. With any, any sample that is detected as non-silence will cause stopped trimming of silence. With all, only if all channels are detected as non-silence will cause stopped trimming of silence.

parameters.name: stop_periods
description: Set the count for trimming silence from the end of audio. To remove silence from the middle of a file, specify a stop_periods that is negative. This value is then treated as a positive value and is used to indicate the effect should restart processing as specified by
start_periods, making it suitable for removing periods of silence in the middle of the audio. Default value is 0.

parameters.name: stop_duration
description: Specify a duration of silence that must exist before audio is not copied any more. By specifying a higher duration, silence that is wanted can be left in the audio. Default value is 0.

parameters.name: stop_threshold
description: This is the same as start_threshold but for trimming silence from the end of audio. Can be specified in dB (in case "dB" is appended to the specified value) or amplitude ratio. Default value is 0.

parameters.name: stop_silence
description: Specify max duration of silence at end that will be kept after trimming. Default is 0, which is equal to trimming all samples detected as silence.

parameters.name: stop_mode
description: Specify mode of detection of silence start in end of multi-channel audio. Can be any or all. Default is any. With any, any sample that is detected as non-silence will cause stopped trimming of silence. With all, only if all channels are detected as non-silence will cause stopped trimming of silence.

parameters.name: detection
description: Set how is silence detected. Can be rms or peak. Second is faster and works better with digital silence which is exactly 0. Default value is rms.

parameters.name: window
description: Set duration in number of seconds used to calculate size of window in number of samples for detecting silence. Default value is 0.02. Allowed range is from 0 to 10.

SOFAlizer uses head-related transfer functions (HRTFs) to create virtual loudspeakers around the user for binaural listening via headphones (audio formats up to 9 channels supported). The HRTFs are stored in SOFA files (see http://www.sofacoustics.org/ for a database). SOFAlizer is developed at the Acoustics Research Institute (ARI) of the Austrian Academy of Sciences.
To enable compilation of this filter you need to configure FFmpeg with
--enable-libmysofa.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: sofalizer

parameters.name: sofa
description: Set the SOFA file used for rendering.

parameters.name: gain
description: Set gain applied to audio. Value is in dB. Default is 0.

parameters.name: rotation
description: Set rotation of virtual loudspeakers in deg. Default is 0.

parameters.name: elevation
description: Set elevation of virtual speakers in deg. Default is 0.

parameters.name: radius
description: Set distance in meters between loudspeakers and the listener with near-field HRTFs. Default is 1.

parameters.name: type
description: Set processing type. Can be time or freq. time is processing audio in time domain which is slow.
freq is processing audio in frequency domain which is fast. Default is freq.

parameters.name: speakers
description: Set custom positions of virtual loudspeakers. Syntax for this option is: <CH> <AZIM> <ELEV>[|<CH> <AZIM> <ELEV>|...]. Each virtual loudspeaker is described with short channel name following with azimuth and elevation in degrees. Each virtual loudspeaker description is separated by ’|’. For example to override front left and front right channel positions use: ’speakers=FL 45 15|FR 345 15’. Descriptions with unrecognised channel names are ignored.

parameters.name: lfegain
description: Set custom gain for LFE channels. Value is in dB. Default is 0.

parameters.name: framesize
description: Set custom frame size in number of samples. Default is 1024. Allowed range is from 1024 to 96000. Only used if option ‘type’ is set to freq.

parameters.name: normalize
description: Should all IRs be normalized upon importing SOFA file. By default is enabled.

parameters.name: interpolate
description: Should nearest IRs be interpolated with neighbor IRs if exact position does not match. By default is disabled.

parameters.name: minphase
description: Minphase all IRs upon loading of SOFA file. By default is disabled.

parameters.name: anglestep
description: Set neighbor search angle step. Only used if option interpolate is enabled.

parameters.name: radstep
description: Set neighbor search radius step. Only used if option interpolate is enabled.

This filter has some handy utilities to manage stereo signals, for converting M/S stereo recordings to L/R signal while having control over the parameters or spreading the stereo image of master track.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: stereotools

parameters.name: level_in
description: Set input level before filtering for both channels. Defaults is 1. Allowed range is from 0.015625 to 64.

parameters.name: level_out
description: Set output level after filtering for both channels. Defaults is 1. Allowed range is from 0.015625 to 64.

parameters.name: balance_in
description: Set input balance between both channels. Default is 0. Allowed range is from -1 to 1.

parameters.name: balance_out
description: Set output balance between both channels. Default is 0. Allowed range is from -1 to 1.

parameters.name: softclip
description: Enable softclipping. Results in analog distortion instead of harsh digital 0dB clipping. Disabled by default.

parameters.name: mutel
description: Mute the left channel. Disabled by default.

parameters.name: muter
description: Mute the right channel. Disabled by default.

parameters.name: phasel
description: Change the phase of the left channel. Disabled by default.

parameters.name: phaser
description: Change the phase of the right channel. Disabled by default.

parameters.name: mode
description: Set stereo mode. Available values are:
‘lr>lr’
Left/Right to Left/Right, this is default.
‘lr>ms’
Left/Right to Mid/Side.
‘ms>lr’
Mid/Side to Left/Right.
‘lr>ll’
Left/Right to Left/Left.
‘lr>rr’
Left/Right to Right/Right.
‘lr>l+r’
Left/Right to Left + Right.
‘lr>rl’
Left/Right to Right/Left.
‘ms>ll’
Mid/Side to Left/Left.
‘ms>rr’
Mid/Side to Right/Right.

parameters.name: slev
description: Set level of side signal. Default is 1. Allowed range is from 0.015625 to 64.

parameters.name: sbal
description: Set balance of side signal. Default is 0. Allowed range is from -1 to 1.

parameters.name: mlev
description: Set level of the middle signal. Default is 1. Allowed range is from 0.015625 to 64.

parameters.name: mpan
description: Set middle signal pan. Default is 0. Allowed range is from -1 to 1.

parameters.name: base
description: Set stereo base between mono and inversed channels. Default is 0. Allowed range is from -1 to 1.

parameters.name: delay
description: Set delay in milliseconds how much to delay left from right channel and vice versa. Default is 0. Allowed range is from -20 to 20.

parameters.name: sclevel
description: Set S/C level. Default is 1. Allowed range is from 1 to 100.

parameters.name: phase
description: Set the stereo phase in degrees. Default is 0. Allowed range is from 0 to 360.

parameters.name: bmode_in
description: Set balance mode for balance_in/balance_out option.
Can be one of the following:
‘balance’
Classic balance mode. Attenuate one channel at time. Gain is raised up to 1.
‘amplitude’
Similar as classic mode above but gain is raised up to 2.
‘power’
Equal power distribution, from -6dB to +6dB range.
This filter enhance the stereo effect by suppressing signal common to both channels and by delaying the signal of left into right and vice versa, thereby widening the stereo effect.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: stereowiden

parameters.name: delay
description: Time in milliseconds of the delay of left signal into right and vice versa. Default is 20 milliseconds.

parameters.name: feedback
description: Amount of gain in delayed signal into right and vice versa. Gives a delay effect of left signal in right output and vice versa which gives widening effect. Default is 0.3.

parameters.name: crossfeed
description: Cross feed of left into right with inverted phase. This helps in suppressing the mono. If the value is 1 it will cancel all the signal common to both channels. Default is 0.3.

parameters.name: drymix
description: Set level of input signal of original channel. Default is 0.8.
Apply 18 band equalizer.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: superequalizer

parameters.name: 1b
description: Set 65Hz band gain.

parameters.name: 2b
description: Set 92Hz band gain.

parameters.name: 3b
description: Set 131Hz band gain.

parameters.name: 4b
description: Set 185Hz band gain.

parameters.name: 5b
description: Set 262Hz band gain.

parameters.name: 6b
description: Set 370Hz band gain.

parameters.name: 7b
description: Set 523Hz band gain.

parameters.name: 8b
description: Set 740Hz band gain.

parameters.name: 9b
description: Set 1047Hz band gain.

parameters.name: 10b
description: Set 1480Hz band gain.

parameters.name: 11b
description: Set 2093Hz band gain.

parameters.name: 12b
description: Set 2960Hz band gain.

parameters.name: 13b
description: Set 4186Hz band gain.

parameters.name: 14b
description: Set 5920Hz band gain.

parameters.name: 15b
description: Set 8372Hz band gain.

parameters.name: 16b
description: Set 11840Hz band gain.

parameters.name: 17b
description: Set 16744Hz band gain.

parameters.name: 18b
description: Set 20000Hz band gain.
Apply audio surround upmix filter.
This filter allows to produce multichannel output from audio stream.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: surround

parameters.name: chl_out
description: Set output channel layout. By default, this is 5.1.
See (ffmpeg-utils)the Channel Layout section in the ffmpeg-utils(1) manual for the required syntax.

parameters.name: chl_in
description: Set input channel layout. By default, this is stereo.
See (ffmpeg-utils)the Channel Layout section in the ffmpeg-utils(1) manual for the required syntax.

parameters.name: level_in
description: Set input volume level. By default, this is 1.

parameters.name: level_out
description: Set output volume level. By default, this is 1.

parameters.name: lfe
description: Enable LFE channel output if output channel layout has it. By default, this is enabled.

parameters.name: lfe_low
description: Set LFE low cut off frequency. By default, this is 128 Hz.

parameters.name: lfe_high
description: Set LFE high cut off frequency. By default, this is 256 Hz.

parameters.name: lfe_mode
description: Set LFE mode, can be add or sub. Default is add. In add mode, LFE channel is created from input audio and added to output. In sub mode, LFE channel is created from input audio and added to output but also all non-LFE output channels are subtracted with output LFE channel.

parameters.name: angle
description: Set angle of stereo surround transform, Allowed range is from 0 to 360. Default is 90.

parameters.name: fc_in
description: Set front center input volume. By default, this is 1.

parameters.name: fc_out
description: Set front center output volume. By default, this is 1.

parameters.name: fl_in
description: Set front left input volume. By default, this is 1.

parameters.name: fl_out
description: Set front left output volume. By default, this is 1.

parameters.name: fr_in
description: Set front right input volume. By default, this is 1.

parameters.name: fr_out
description: Set front right output volume. By default, this is 1.

parameters.name: sl_in
description: Set side left input volume. By default, this is 1.

parameters.name: sl_out
description: Set side left output volume. By default, this is 1.

parameters.name: sr_in
description: Set side right input volume. By default, this is 1.

parameters.name: sr_out
description: Set side right output volume. By default, this is 1.

parameters.name: bl_in
description: Set back left input volume. By default, this is 1.

parameters.name: bl_out
description: Set back left output volume. By default, this is 1.

parameters.name: br_in
description: Set back right input volume. By default, this is 1.

parameters.name: br_out
description: Set back right output volume. By default, this is 1.

parameters.name: bc_in
description: Set back center input volume. By default, this is 1.

parameters.name: bc_out
description: Set back center output volume. By default, this is 1.

parameters.name: lfe_in
description: Set LFE input volume. By default, this is 1.

parameters.name: lfe_out
description: Set LFE output volume. By default, this is 1.

parameters.name: allx
description: Set spread usage of stereo image across X axis for all channels.

parameters.name: ally
description: Set spread usage of stereo image across Y axis for all channels.

parameters.name: fcx
description: Set spread usage of stereo image across X axis for each channel.

parameters.name: fcy
description: Set spread usage of stereo image across Y axis for each channel.

parameters.name: win_size
description: Set window size. Allowed range is from 1024 to 65536. Default size is 4096.

parameters.name: win_func
description: Set window function.
It accepts the following values:
‘rect’
‘bartlett’
‘hann, hanning’
‘hamming’
‘blackman’
‘welch’
‘flattop’
‘bharris’
‘bnuttall’
‘bhann’
‘sine’
‘nuttall’
‘lanczos’
‘gauss’
‘tukey’
‘dolph’
‘cauchy’
‘parzen’
‘poisson’
‘bohman’
Default is hann.

parameters.name: overlap
description: Set window overlap. If set to 1, the recommended overlap for selected window function will be picked. Default is 0.5.

Boost or cut treble (upper) frequencies of the audio using a two-pole shelving filter with a response similar to that of a standard hi-fi’s tone-controls. This is also known as shelving equalisation (EQ).
The filter accepts the following options:
name: treble

parameters.name: gain
description: Give the gain at whichever is the lower of ~22 kHz and the Nyquist frequency. Its useful range is about -20 (for a large cut) to +20 (for a large boost). Beware of clipping when using a positive gain.

parameters.name: frequency
description: Set the filter’s central frequency and so can be used to extend or reduce the frequency range to be boosted or cut. The default value is 3000 Hz.

parameters.name: width_type
description: Set method to specify band-width of filter.
h
Hz
q
Q-Factor
o
octave
s
slope
k
kHz

parameters.name: width
description: Determine how steep is the filter’s shelf transition.

parameters.name: mix
description: How much to use filtered signal in output. Default is 1. Range is between 0 and 1.

parameters.name: channels
description: Specify which channels to filter, by default all available are filtered.

parameters.name: normalize
description: Normalize biquad coefficients, by default is disabled. Enabling it will normalize magnitude response at DC to 0dB.

Boost or cut treble (upper) frequencies of the audio using a two-pole shelving filter with a response similar to that of a standard hi-fi’s tone-controls. This is also known as shelving equalisation (EQ).
The filter accepts the following options:
name: highshelf

parameters.name: gain
description: Give the gain at whichever is the lower of ~22 kHz and the Nyquist frequency. Its useful range is about -20 (for a large cut) to +20 (for a large boost). Beware of clipping when using a positive gain.

parameters.name: frequency
description: Set the filter’s central frequency and so can be used to extend or reduce the frequency range to be boosted or cut. The default value is 3000 Hz.

parameters.name: width_type
description: Set method to specify band-width of filter.
h
Hz
q
Q-Factor
o
octave
s
slope
k
kHz

parameters.name: width
description: Determine how steep is the filter’s shelf transition.

parameters.name: mix
description: How much to use filtered signal in output. Default is 1. Range is between 0 and 1.

parameters.name: channels
description: Specify which channels to filter, by default all available are filtered.

parameters.name: normalize
description: Normalize biquad coefficients, by default is disabled. Enabling it will normalize magnitude response at DC to 0dB.
Sinusoidal amplitude modulation.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: tremolo

parameters.name: f
description: Modulation frequency in Hertz. Modulation frequencies in the subharmonic range (20 Hz or lower) will result in a tremolo effect. This filter may also be used as a ring modulator by specifying a modulation frequency higher than 20 Hz. Range is 0.1 - 20000.0. Default value is 5.0 Hz.

parameters.name: d
description: Depth of modulation as a percentage. Range is 0.0 - 1.0. Default value is 0.5.
Sinusoidal phase modulation.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: vibrato

parameters.name: f
description: Modulation frequency in Hertz. Range is 0.1 - 20000.0. Default value is 5.0 Hz.

parameters.name: d
description: Depth of modulation as a percentage. Range is 0.0 - 1.0. Default value is 0.5.
Adjust the input audio volume.
It accepts the following parameters:
name: volume

parameters.name: volume
description: Set audio volume expression.
Output values are clipped to the maximum value.
The output audio volume is given by the relation:
output_volume = volume * input_volume
The default value for volume is "1.0".

parameters.name: precision
description: This parameter represents the mathematical precision.
It determines which input sample formats will be allowed, which affects the precision of the volume scaling.
fixed
8-bit fixed-point; this limits input sample format to U8, S16, and S32.
float
32-bit floating-point; this limits input sample format to FLT. (default)
double
64-bit floating-point; this limits input sample format to DBL.

parameters.name: replaygain
description: Choose the behaviour on encountering ReplayGain side data in input frames.
drop
Remove ReplayGain side data, ignoring its contents (the default).
ignore
Ignore ReplayGain side data, but leave it in the frame.
track
Prefer the track gain, if present.
album
Prefer the album gain, if present.

parameters.name: replaygain_preamp
description: Pre-amplification gain in dB to apply to the selected replaygain gain.
Default value for replaygain_preamp is 0.0.

parameters.name: replaygain_noclip
description: Prevent clipping by limiting the gain applied.
Default value for replaygain_noclip is 1.

parameters.name: eval
description: Set when the volume expression is evaluated.
It accepts the following values:
‘once’
only evaluate expression once during the filter initialization, or when the ‘volume’ command is sent
‘frame’
evaluate expression for each incoming frame
Default value is ‘once’.
Detect the volume of the input video.
The filter has no parameters. The input is not modified. Statistics about the volume will be printed in the log when the input stream end is reached.

In particular it will show the mean volume (root mean square), maximum volume (on a per-sample basis), and the beginning of a histogram of the registered volume values (from the maximum value to a cumulated 1/1000 of the samples).
All volumes are in decibels relative to the maximum PCM value.
name: volumedetect

description: Buffer audio frames, and make them available to the filter chain.
This source is mainly intended for a programmatic use, in particular through the interface defined in libavfilter/asrc_abuffer.h.
It accepts the following parameters:
name: abuffer

parameters.name: time_base
description: The timebase which will be used for timestamps of submitted frames. It must be either a floating-point number or in numerator/denominator form.

parameters.name: sample_rate
description: The sample rate of the incoming audio buffers.

parameters.name: sample_fmt
description: The sample format of the incoming audio buffers. Either a sample format name or its corresponding integer representation from the enum AVSampleFormat in libavutil/samplefmt.h

parameters.name: channel_layout
description: The channel layout of the incoming audio buffers. Either a channel layout name from channel_layout_map in
libavutil/channel_layout.c or its corresponding integer representation from the AV_CH_LAYOUT_* macros in libavutil/channel_layout.h

parameters.name: channels
description: The number of channels of the incoming audio buffers. If both channels and channel_layout are specified, then they must be consistent.
Generate an audio signal specified by an expression.
This source accepts in input one or more expressions (one for each channel), which are evaluated and used to generate a corresponding audio signal.
This source accepts the following options:
name: aevalsrc

parameters.name: exprs
description: Set the ’|’-separated expressions list for each separate channel. In case the
channel_layout option is not specified, the selected channel layout depends on the number of provided expressions. Otherwise the last specified expression is applied to the remaining output channels.

parameters.name: channel_layout
description: Set the channel layout. The number of channels in the specified layout must be equal to the number of specified expressions.

parameters.name: duration
description: Set the minimum duration of the sourced audio. See

(ffmpeg-utils)the Time duration section in the ffmpeg-utils(1) manual for the accepted syntax. Note that the resulting duration may be greater than the specified duration, as the generated audio is always cut at the end of a complete frame.
If not specified, or the expressed duration is negative, the audio is supposed to be generated forever.

parameters.name: nb_samples
description: Set the number of samples per channel per each output frame, default to 1024.

parameters.name: sample_rate
description: Specify the sample rate, default to 44100.

The null audio source, return unprocessed audio frames. It is mainly useful as a template and to be employed in analysis / debugging tools, or as the source for filters which ignore the input data (for example the sox synth filter).
This source accepts the following options:
name: anullsrc

parameters.name: channel_layout
description: Specifies the channel layout, and can be either an integer or a string representing a channel layout. The default value of channel_layout is "stereo".
Check the channel_layout_map definition in
libavutil/channel_layout.c for the mapping between strings and channel layout values.

parameters.name: sample_rate
description: Specifies the sample rate, and defaults to 44100.

parameters.name: nb_samples
description: Set the number of samples per requested frames.
Synthesize a voice utterance using the libflite library.
To enable compilation of this filter you need to configure FFmpeg with
--enable-libflite.
Note that versions of the flite library prior to 2.0 are not thread-safe.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: flite

parameters.name: list_voices
description: If set to 1, list the names of the available voices and exit immediately. Default value is 0.

parameters.name: nb_samples
description: Set the maximum number of samples per frame. Default value is 512.

parameters.name: textfile
description: Set the filename containing the text to speak.

parameters.name: text
description: Set the text to speak.

parameters.name: voice
description: Set the voice to use for the speech synthesis. Default value is
kal. See also the list_voices option.
Generate a noise audio signal.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: anoisesrc

parameters.name: sample_rate
description: Specify the sample rate. Default value is 48000 Hz.

parameters.name: amplitude
description: Specify the amplitude (0.0 - 1.0) of the generated audio stream. Default value is 1.0.

parameters.name: duration
description: Specify the duration of the generated audio stream. Not specifying this option results in noise with an infinite length.

parameters.name: color
description: Specify the color of noise. Available noise colors are white, pink, brown, blue, violet and velvet. Default color is white.

parameters.name: seed
description: Specify a value used to seed the PRNG.

parameters.name: nb_samples
description: Set the number of samples per each output frame, default is 1024.
Generate odd-tap Hilbert transform FIR coefficients.
The resulting stream can be used with afir filter for phase-shifting the signal by 90 degrees.
This is used in many matrix coding schemes and for analytic signal generation. The process is often written as a multiplication by i (or j), the imaginary unit.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: hilbert

parameters.name: sample_rate
description: Set sample rate, default is 44100.

parameters.name: taps
description: Set length of FIR filter, default is 22051.

parameters.name: nb_samples
description: Set number of samples per each frame.

parameters.name: win_func
description: Set window function to be used when generating FIR coefficients.
Generate a sinc kaiser-windowed low-pass, high-pass, band-pass, or band-reject FIR coefficients.
The resulting stream can be used with afir filter for filtering the audio signal.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: sinc

parameters.name: sample_rate
description: Set sample rate, default is 44100.

parameters.name: nb_samples
description: Set number of samples per each frame. Default is 1024.

parameters.name: hp
description: Set high-pass frequency. Default is 0.

parameters.name: lp
description: Set low-pass frequency. Default is 0. If high-pass frequency is lower than low-pass frequency and low-pass frequency is higher than 0 then filter will create band-pass filter coefficients, otherwise band-reject filter coefficients.

parameters.name: phase
description: Set filter phase response. Default is 50. Allowed range is from 0 to 100.

parameters.name: beta
description: Set Kaiser window beta.

parameters.name: att
description: Set stop-band attenuation. Default is 120dB, allowed range is from 40 to 180 dB.

parameters.name: round
description: Enable rounding, by default is disabled.

parameters.name: hptaps
description: Set number of taps for high-pass filter.

parameters.name: lptaps
description: Set number of taps for low-pass filter.
Generate an audio signal made of a sine wave with amplitude 1/8.
The audio signal is bit-exact.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: sine

parameters.name: frequency
description: Set the carrier frequency. Default is 440 Hz.

parameters.name: beep_factor
description: Enable a periodic beep every second with frequency beep_factor times the carrier frequency. Default is 0, meaning the beep is disabled.

parameters.name: sample_rate
description: Specify the sample rate, default is 44100.

parameters.name: duration
description: Specify the duration of the generated audio stream.

parameters.name: samples_per_frame
description: Set the number of samples per output frame.
The expression can contain the following constants:
n
The (sequential) number of the output audio frame, starting from 0.
pts
The PTS (Presentation TimeStamp) of the output audio frame, expressed in TB units.
t
The PTS of the output audio frame, expressed in seconds.
TB
The timebase of the output audio frames.
Default is 1024.
Buffer audio frames, and make them available to the end of filter chain.
This sink is mainly intended for programmatic use, in particular through the interface defined in libavfilter/buffersink.h or the options system.
It accepts a pointer to an AVABufferSinkContext structure, which defines the incoming buffers’ formats, to be passed as the opaque parameter to avfilter_init_filter for initialization.
name: abuffersink

description: Null audio sink; do absolutely nothing with the input audio. It is mainly useful as a template and for use in analysis / debugging tools.
11 Video Filters
When you configure your FFmpeg build, you can disable any of the existing filters using --disable-filters. The configure output will show the video filters included in your build.
Below is a description of the currently available video filters.
name: anullsink

description: Mark a region of interest in a video frame.

The frame data is passed through unchanged, but metadata is attached to the frame indicating regions of interest which can affect the behaviour of later encoding. Multiple regions can be marked by applying the filter multiple times.
name: addroi

parameters.name: x
description: Region distance in pixels from the left edge of the frame.

parameters.name: y
description: Region distance in pixels from the top edge of the frame.

parameters.name: w
description: Region width in pixels.

parameters.name: h
description: Region height in pixels.
The parameters x, y, w and h are expressions, and may contain the following variables:
iw
Width of the input frame.
ih
Height of the input frame.

parameters.name: qoffset
description: Quantisation offset to apply within the region.

This must be a real value in the range -1 to +1. A value of zero indicates no quality change. A negative value asks for better quality (less quantisation), while a positive value asks for worse quality (greater quantisation).

The range is calibrated so that the extreme values indicate the largest possible offset - if the rest of the frame is encoded with the worst possible quality, an offset of -1 indicates that this region should be encoded with the best possible quality anyway. Intermediate values are then interpolated in some codec-dependent way.

For example, in 10-bit H.264 the quantisation parameter varies between -12 and 51. A typical qoffset value of -1/10 therefore indicates that this region should be encoded with a QP around one-tenth of the full range better than the rest of the frame. So, if most of the frame were to be encoded with a QP of around 30, this region would get a QP of around 24 (an offset of approximately -1/10 * (51 - -12) = -6.3). An extreme value of -1 would indicate that this region should be encoded with the best possible quality regardless of the treatment of the rest of the frame - that is, should be encoded at a QP of -12.

parameters.name: clear
description: If set to true, remove any existing regions of interest marked on the frame before adding the new one.
Extract the alpha component from the input as a grayscale video. This is especially useful with the alphamerge filter.
name: alphaextract

description: Add or replace the alpha component of the primary input with the grayscale value of a second input. This is intended for use with
alphaextract to allow the transmission or storage of frame sequences that have alpha in a format that doesn’t support an alpha channel.
For example, to reconstruct full frames from a normal YUV-encoded video and a separate video created with alphaextract, you might use:
movie=in_alpha.mkv [alpha]; [in][alpha] alphamerge [out]

Since this filter is designed for reconstruction, it operates on frame sequences without considering timestamps, and terminates when either input reaches end of stream. This will cause problems if your encoding pipeline drops frames. If you’re trying to apply an image as an overlay to a video stream, consider the overlay filter instead.
name: alphamerge

description: Amplify differences between current pixel and pixels of adjacent frames in same pixel location.
This filter accepts the following options:
name: amplify

parameters.name: radius
description: Set frame radius. Default is 2. Allowed range is from 1 to 63. For example radius of 3 will instruct filter to calculate average of 7 frames.

parameters.name: factor
description: Set factor to amplify difference. Default is 2. Allowed range is from 0 to 65535.

parameters.name: threshold
description: Set threshold for difference amplification. Any difference greater or equal to this value will not alter source pixel. Default is 10. Allowed range is from 0 to 65535.

parameters.name: tolerance
description: Set tolerance for difference amplification. Any difference lower to this value will not alter source pixel. Default is 0. Allowed range is from 0 to 65535.

parameters.name: low
description: Set lower limit for changing source pixel. Default is 65535. Allowed range is from 0 to 65535. This option controls maximum possible value that will decrease source pixel value.

parameters.name: high
description: Set high limit for changing source pixel. Default is 65535. Allowed range is from 0 to 65535. This option controls maximum possible value that will increase source pixel value.

parameters.name: planes
description: Set which planes to filter. Default is all. Allowed range is from 0 to 15.
Same as the subtitles filter, except that it doesn’t require libavcodec and libavformat to work. On the other hand, it is limited to ASS (Advanced Substation Alpha) subtitles files.
This filter accepts the following option in addition to the common options from the subtitles filter:
name: ass

parameters.name: shaping
description: Set the shaping engine
Available values are:
‘auto’
The default libass shaping engine, which is the best available.
‘simple’
Fast, font-agnostic shaper that can do only substitutions
‘complex’
Slower shaper using OpenType for substitutions and positioning
The default is auto.
Apply an Adaptive Temporal Averaging Denoiser to the video input.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: atadenoise

parameters.name: 0a
description: Set threshold A for 1st plane. Default is 0.02. Valid range is 0 to 0.3.

parameters.name: 0b
description: Set threshold B for 1st plane. Default is 0.04. Valid range is 0 to 5.

parameters.name: 1a
description: Set threshold A for 2nd plane. Default is 0.02. Valid range is 0 to 0.3.

parameters.name: 1b
description: Set threshold B for 2nd plane. Default is 0.04. Valid range is 0 to 5.

parameters.name: 2a
description: Set threshold A for 3rd plane. Default is 0.02. Valid range is 0 to 0.3.

parameters.name: 2b
description: Set threshold B for 3rd plane. Default is 0.04. Valid range is 0 to 5.
Threshold A is designed to react on abrupt changes in the input signal and threshold B is designed to react on continuous changes in the input signal.

parameters.name: s
description: Set number of frames filter will use for averaging. Default is 9. Must be odd number in range [5, 129].

parameters.name: p
description: Set what planes of frame filter will use for averaging. Default is all.

parameters.name: a
description: Set what variant of algorithm filter will use for averaging. Default is p parallel. Alternatively can be set to s serial.

Parallel can be faster then serial, while other way around is never true. Parallel will abort early on first change being greater then thresholds, while serial will continue processing other side of frames if they are equal or bellow thresholds.
Apply average blur filter.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: avgblur

parameters.name: sizeX
description: Set horizontal radius size.

parameters.name: planes
description: Set which planes to filter. By default all planes are filtered.

parameters.name: sizeY
description: Set vertical radius size, if zero it will be same as sizeX. Default is 0.
Compute the bounding box for the non-black pixels in the input frame luminance plane.

This filter computes the bounding box containing all the pixels with a luminance value greater than the minimum allowed value. The parameters describing the bounding box are printed on the filter log.
The filter accepts the following option:
name: bbox

parameters.name: min_val
description: Set the minimal luminance value. Default is 16.
Apply bilateral filter, spatial smoothing while preserving edges.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: bilateral

parameters.name: sigmaS
description: Set sigma of gaussian function to calculate spatial weight. Allowed range is 0 to 10. Default is 0.1.

parameters.name: sigmaR
description: Set sigma of gaussian function to calculate range weight. Allowed range is 0 to 1. Default is 0.1.

parameters.name: planes
description: Set planes to filter. Default is first only.
Show and measure bit plane noise.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: bitplanenoise

parameters.name: bitplane
description: Set which plane to analyze. Default is 1.

parameters.name: filter
description: Filter out noisy pixels from bitplane set above. Default is disabled.

Detect video intervals that are (almost) completely black. Can be useful to detect chapter transitions, commercials, or invalid recordings. Output lines contains the time for the start, end and duration of the detected black interval expressed in seconds.
In order to display the output lines, you need to set the loglevel at least to the AV_LOG_INFO value.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: blackdetect

parameters.name: black_min_duration
description: Set the minimum detected black duration expressed in seconds. It must be a non-negative floating point number.
Default value is 2.0.

parameters.name: picture_black_ratio_th
description: Set the threshold for considering a picture "black". Express the minimum value for the ratio:
nb_black_pixels / nb_pixels
for which a picture is considered black. Default value is 0.98.

parameters.name: pixel_black_th
description: Set the threshold for considering a pixel "black".
The threshold expresses the maximum pixel luminance value for which a pixel is considered "black". The provided value is scaled according to the following equation:
absolute_threshold = luminance_minimum_value + pixel_black_th * luminance_range_size
luminance_range_size and luminance_minimum_value depend on the input video format, the range is [0-255] for YUV full-range formats and [16-235] for YUV non full-range formats.
Default value is 0.10.

Detect frames that are (almost) completely black. Can be useful to detect chapter transitions or commercials. Output lines consist of the frame number of the detected frame, the percentage of blackness, the position in the file if known or -1 and the timestamp in seconds.
In order to display the output lines, you need to set the loglevel at least to the AV_LOG_INFO value.
This filter exports frame metadata lavfi.blackframe.pblack. The value represents the percentage of pixels in the picture that are below the threshold value.
It accepts the following parameters:
name: blackframe

parameters.name: amount
description: The percentage of the pixels that have to be below the threshold; it defaults to

parameters.name: threshold
description: The threshold below which a pixel value is considered black; it defaults to
Blend two video frames into each other.

The blend filter takes two input streams and outputs one stream, the first input is the "top" layer and second input is "bottom" layer. By default, the output terminates when the longest input terminates.
The tblend (time blend) filter takes two consecutive frames from one single stream, and outputs the result obtained by blending the new frame on top of the old frame.
A description of the accepted options follows.
name: blend

parameters.name: c0_mode
description: Set blend mode for specific pixel component or all pixel components in case of all_mode. Default value is normal.
Available values for component modes are:
‘addition’
‘grainmerge’
‘and’
‘average’
‘burn’
‘darken’
‘difference’
‘grainextract’
‘divide’
‘dodge’
‘freeze’
‘exclusion’
‘extremity’
‘glow’
‘hardlight’
‘hardmix’
‘heat’
‘lighten’
‘linearlight’
‘multiply’
‘multiply128’
‘negation’
‘normal’
‘or’
‘overlay’
‘phoenix’
‘pinlight’
‘reflect’
‘screen’
‘softlight’
‘subtract’
‘vividlight’
‘xor’

parameters.name: c1_mode
description: Set blend opacity for specific pixel component or all pixel components in case of all_opacity. Only used in combination with pixel component blend modes.

parameters.name: c2_mode
description: Set blend expression for specific pixel component or all pixel components in case of all_expr. Note that related mode options will be ignored if those are set.
The expressions can use the following variables:
N
The sequential number of the filtered frame, starting from 0.
X
Y
the coordinates of the current sample
W
H
the width and height of currently filtered plane
SW
SH

Width and height scale for the plane being filtered. It is the ratio between the dimensions of the current plane to the luma plane, e.g. for a yuv420p frame, the values are 1,1 for the luma plane and 0.5,0.5 for the chroma planes.
T
Time of the current frame, expressed in seconds.
TOP, A
Value of pixel component at current location for first video frame (top layer).
BOTTOM, B
Value of pixel component at current location for second video frame (bottom layer).
Blend two video frames into each other.

The blend filter takes two input streams and outputs one stream, the first input is the "top" layer and second input is "bottom" layer. By default, the output terminates when the longest input terminates.

parameters.name: c1_mode
description: Set blend opacity for specific pixel component or all pixel components in case of all_opacity. Only used in combination with pixel component blend modes.

parameters.name: c2_mode
description: Set blend expression for specific pixel component or all pixel components in case of all_expr. Note that related mode options will be ignored if those are set.
The expressions can use the following variables:

The sequential number of the filtered frame, starting from 0.

the coordinates of the current sample

Width and height scale for the plane being filtered. It is the ratio between the dimensions of the current plane to the luma plane, e.g. for a yuv420p frame, the values are 1,1 for the luma plane and 0.5,0.5 for the chroma planes.

Denoise frames using Block-Matching 3D algorithm.
The filter accepts the following options.
name: bm3d

parameters.name: sigma
description: Set denoising strength. Default value is 1. Allowed range is from 0 to 999.9. The denoising algorithm is very sensitive to sigma, so adjust it according to the source.

parameters.name: block
description: Set local patch size. This sets dimensions in 2D.

parameters.name: bstep
description: Set sliding step for processing blocks. Default value is 4. Allowed range is from 1 to 64. Smaller values allows processing more reference blocks and is slower.

parameters.name: group
description: Set maximal number of similar blocks for 3rd dimension. Default value is 1. When set to 1, no block matching is done. Larger values allows more blocks in single group. Allowed range is from 1 to 256.

parameters.name: range
description: Set radius for search block matching. Default is 9. Allowed range is from 1 to INT32_MAX.

parameters.name: mstep
description: Set step between two search locations for block matching. Default is 1. Allowed range is from 1 to 64. Smaller is slower.

parameters.name: thmse
description: Set threshold of mean square error for block matching. Valid range is 0 to INT32_MAX.

parameters.name: hdthr
description: Set thresholding parameter for hard thresholding in 3D transformed domain. Larger values results in stronger hard-thresholding filtering in frequency domain.

parameters.name: estim
description: Set filtering estimation mode. Can be basic or final. Default is basic.

parameters.name: ref
description: If enabled, filter will use 2nd stream for block matching. Default is disabled for basic value of estim option, and always enabled if value of estim is final.

parameters.name: planes
description: Set planes to filter. Default is all available except alpha.
Apply a boxblur algorithm to the input video.
It accepts the following parameters:
name: boxblur

description: Deinterlace the input video ("bwdif" stands for "Bob Weaver Deinterlacing Filter").
Motion adaptive deinterlacing based on yadif with the use of w3fdif and cubic interpolation algorithms. It accepts the following parameters:
name: bwdif

parameters.name: mode
description: The interlacing mode to adopt. It accepts one of the following values:
0, send_frame
Output one frame for each frame.
1, send_field
Output one frame for each field.
The default value is send_field.

parameters.name: parity
description: The picture field parity assumed for the input interlaced video. It accepts one of the following values:
0, tff
Assume the top field is first.
1, bff
Assume the bottom field is first.
-1, auto
Enable automatic detection of field parity.
The default value is auto. If the interlacing is unknown or the decoder does not export this information, top field first will be assumed.

parameters.name: deint
description: Specify which frames to deinterlace. Accepts one of the following values:
0, all
Deinterlace all frames.
1, interlaced
Only deinterlace frames marked as interlaced.
The default value is all.
Remove all color information for all colors except for certain one.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: chromahold

parameters.name: color
description: The color which will not be replaced with neutral chroma.

parameters.name: similarity
description: Similarity percentage with the above color. 0.01 matches only the exact key color, while 1.0 matches everything.

parameters.name: blend
description: Blend percentage. 0.0 makes pixels either fully gray, or not gray at all. Higher values result in more preserved color.

parameters.name: yuv
description: Signals that the color passed is already in YUV instead of RGB.
Literal colors like "green" or "red" don’t make sense with this enabled anymore. This can be used to pass exact YUV values as hexadecimal numbers.
YUV colorspace color/chroma keying.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: chromakey

parameters.name: color
description: The color which will be replaced with transparency.

parameters.name: similarity
description: Similarity percentage with the key color.
0.01 matches only the exact key color, while 1.0 matches everything.

parameters.name: blend
description: Blend percentage.
0.0 makes pixels either fully transparent, or not transparent at all.
Higher values result in semi-transparent pixels, with a higher transparency the more similar the pixels color is to the key color.

parameters.name: yuv
description: Signals that the color passed is already in YUV instead of RGB.
Literal colors like "green" or "red" don’t make sense with this enabled anymore. This can be used to pass exact YUV values as hexadecimal numbers.
Shift chroma pixels horizontally and/or vertically.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: chromashift

parameters.name: cbh
description: Set amount to shift chroma-blue horizontally.

parameters.name: cbv
description: Set amount to shift chroma-blue vertically.

parameters.name: crh
description: Set amount to shift chroma-red horizontally.

parameters.name: crv
description: Set amount to shift chroma-red vertically.

parameters.name: edge
description: Set edge mode, can be smear, default, or warp.
Display CIE color diagram with pixels overlaid onto it.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: ciescope

parameters.name: system
description: Set color system.
‘ntsc, 470m’
‘ebu, 470bg’
‘smpte’
‘apple’
‘widergb’
‘rec709, hdtv’
‘uhdtv, rec2020’
‘dcip3’

parameters.name: cie
description: Set CIE system.
‘xyy’
‘ucs’
‘luv’

parameters.name: gamuts
description: Set what gamuts to draw.
See system option for available values.

parameters.name: size
description: Set ciescope size, by default set to 512.

parameters.name: intensity
description: Set intensity used to map input pixel values to CIE diagram.

parameters.name: contrast
description: Set contrast used to draw tongue colors that are out of active color system gamut.

parameters.name: corrgamma
description: Correct gamma displayed on scope, by default enabled.

parameters.name: showwhite
description: Show white point on CIE diagram, by default disabled.

parameters.name: gamma
description: Set input gamma. Used only with XYZ input color space.
Visualize information exported by some codecs.
Some codecs can export information through frames using side-data or other means. For example, some MPEG based codecs export motion vectors through the
export_mvs flag in the codec flags2 option.
The filter accepts the following option:
name: codecview

parameters.name: mv
description: Set motion vectors to visualize.
Available flags for mv are:
‘pf’
forward predicted MVs of P-frames
‘bf’
forward predicted MVs of B-frames
‘bb’
backward predicted MVs of B-frames

parameters.name: qp
description: Display quantization parameters using the chroma planes.

parameters.name: mv_type
description: Set motion vectors type to visualize. Includes MVs from all frames unless specified by frame_type option.
Available flags for mv_type are:
‘fp’
forward predicted MVs
‘bp’
backward predicted MVs

parameters.name: frame_type
description: Set frame type to visualize motion vectors of.
Available flags for frame_type are:
‘if’
intra-coded frames (I-frames)
‘pf’
predicted frames (P-frames)
‘bf’
bi-directionally predicted frames (B-frames)
Modify intensity of primary colors (red, green and blue) of input frames.
The filter allows an input frame to be adjusted in the shadows, midtones or highlights regions for the red-cyan, green-magenta or blue-yellow balance.
A positive adjustment value shifts the balance towards the primary color, a negative value towards the complementary color.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: colorbalance

parameters.name: rs
description: Adjust red, green and blue shadows (darkest pixels).

parameters.name: gs
description: Adjust red, green and blue midtones (medium pixels).

parameters.name: bs
description: Adjust red, green and blue highlights (brightest pixels).
Allowed ranges for options are [-1.0, 1.0]. Defaults are 0.

parameters.name: rm
description: Preserve lightness when changing color balance. Default is disabled.
Adjust video input frames by re-mixing color channels.
This filter modifies a color channel by adding the values associated to the other channels of the same pixels. For example if the value to modify is red, the output value will be:
red=red*rr + blue*rb + green*rg + alpha*ra
The filter accepts the following options:
name: colorchannelmixer

parameters.name: rr
description: Adjust contribution of input red, green, blue and alpha channels for output red channel. Default is 1 for rr, and 0 for rg, rb and ra.

parameters.name: rg
description: Adjust contribution of input red, green, blue and alpha channels for output green channel. Default is 1 for gg, and 0 for gr, gb and ga.

parameters.name: rb
description: Adjust contribution of input red, green, blue and alpha channels for output blue channel. Default is 1 for bb, and 0 for br, bg and ba.

parameters.name: ra
description: Adjust contribution of input red, green, blue and alpha channels for output alpha channel. Default is 1 for aa, and 0 for ar, ag and ab.
Allowed ranges for options are [-2.0, 2.0].
RGB colorspace color keying.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: colorkey

parameters.name: color
description: The color which will be replaced with transparency.

parameters.name: similarity
description: Similarity percentage with the key color.
0.01 matches only the exact key color, while 1.0 matches everything.

parameters.name: blend
description: Blend percentage.
0.0 makes pixels either fully transparent, or not transparent at all.
Higher values result in semi-transparent pixels, with a higher transparency the more similar the pixels color is to the key color.
Remove all color information for all RGB colors except for certain one.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: colorhold

parameters.name: color
description: The color which will not be replaced with neutral gray.

parameters.name: similarity
description: Similarity percentage with the above color. 0.01 matches only the exact key color, while 1.0 matches everything.

parameters.name: blend
description: Blend percentage. 0.0 makes pixels fully gray. Higher values result in more preserved color.
Adjust video input frames using levels.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: colorlevels

parameters.name: rimin
description: Adjust red, green, blue and alpha input black point. Allowed ranges for options are [-1.0, 1.0]. Defaults are 0.

parameters.name: gimin
description: Adjust red, green, blue and alpha input white point. Allowed ranges for options are [-1.0, 1.0]. Defaults are 1.
Input levels are used to lighten highlights (bright tones), darken shadows (dark tones), change the balance of bright and dark tones.

parameters.name: bimin
description: Adjust red, green, blue and alpha output black point. Allowed ranges for options are [0, 1.0]. Defaults are 0.

parameters.name: aimin
description: Adjust red, green, blue and alpha output white point. Allowed ranges for options are [0, 1.0]. Defaults are 1.
Output levels allows manual selection of a constrained output level range.

parameters.name: src

‘fcc’

BT.470BG
