Apply roberts cross operator to input video stream.
The filter accepts the following option:
name: roberts

parameters.name: planes
description: Set which planes will be processed, unprocessed planes will be copied. By default value 0xf, all planes will be processed.

parameters.name: scale
description: Set value which will be multiplied with filtered result.

parameters.name: delta
description: Set value which will be added to filtered result.
Rotate video by an arbitrary angle expressed in radians.
The filter accepts the following options:
A description of the optional parameters follows.
name: rotate

parameters.name: angle
description: Set an expression for the angle by which to rotate the input video clockwise, expressed as a number of radians. A negative value will result in a counter-clockwise rotation. By default it is set to "0".
This expression is evaluated for each frame.

parameters.name: out_w
description: Set the output width expression, default value is "iw". This expression is evaluated just once during configuration.

parameters.name: out_h
description: Set the output height expression, default value is "ih". This expression is evaluated just once during configuration.

parameters.name: bilinear
description: Enable bilinear interpolation if set to 1, a value of 0 disables it. Default value is 1.

parameters.name: fillcolor
description: Set the color used to fill the output area not covered by the rotated image. For the general syntax of this option, check the
(ffmpeg-utils)"Color" section in the ffmpeg-utils manual. If the special value "none" is selected then no background is printed (useful for example if the background is never shown).
Default value is "black".
Apply Shape Adaptive Blur.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: sab

parameters.name: luma_radius
description: Set luma blur filter strength, must be a value in range 0.1-4.0, default value is 1.0. A greater value will result in a more blurred image, and in slower processing.

parameters.name: luma_pre_filter_radius
description: Set luma pre-filter radius, must be a value in the 0.1-2.0 range, default value is 1.0.

parameters.name: luma_strength
description: Set luma maximum difference between pixels to still be considered, must be a value in the 0.1-100.0 range, default value is 1.0.

parameters.name: chroma_radius
description: Set chroma blur filter strength, must be a value in range -0.9-4.0. A greater value will result in a more blurred image, and in slower processing.

parameters.name: chroma_pre_filter_radius
description: Set chroma pre-filter radius, must be a value in the -0.9-2.0 range.

parameters.name: chroma_strength
description: Set chroma maximum difference between pixels to still be considered, must be a value in the -0.9-100.0 range.
Scale (resize) the input video, using the libswscale library.
The scale filter forces the output display aspect ratio to be the same of the input, by changing the output sample aspect ratio.
If the input image format is different from the format requested by the next filter, the scale filter will convert the input to the requested format.
name: scale

description: Use the NVIDIA Performance Primitives (libnpp) to perform scaling and/or pixel format conversion on CUDA video frames. Setting the output width and height works in the same way as for the scale filter.
The following additional options are accepted:
name: scale_npp

parameters.name: format
description: The pixel format of the output CUDA frames. If set to the string "same" (the default), the input format will be kept. Note that automatic format negotiation and conversion is not yet supported for hardware frames

parameters.name: interp_algo
description: The interpolation algorithm used for resizing. One of the following:
nn
Nearest neighbour.
linear
cubic
cubic2p_bspline
2-parameter cubic (B=1, C=0)
cubic2p_catmullrom
2-parameter cubic (B=0, C=1/2)
cubic2p_b05c03
2-parameter cubic (B=1/2, C=3/10)
super
Supersampling
lanczos

parameters.name: force_original_aspect_ratio
description: Enable decreasing or increasing output video width or height if necessary to keep the original aspect ratio. Possible values:
‘disable’
Scale the video as specified and disable this feature.
‘decrease’
The output video dimensions will automatically be decreased if needed.
‘increase’
The output video dimensions will automatically be increased if needed.

One useful instance of this option is that when you know a specific device’s maximum allowed resolution, you can use this to limit the output video to that, while retaining the aspect ratio. For example, device A allows 1280x720 playback, and your video is 1920x800. Using this option (set it to decrease) and specifying 1280x720 to the command line makes the output 1280x533.
Please note that this is a different thing than specifying -1 for w or h, you still need to specify the output resolution for this option to work.

parameters.name: force_divisible_by
description: Ensures that both the output dimensions, width and height, are divisible by the given integer when used together with force_original_aspect_ratio. This works similar to using -n in the w and h options.
This option respects the value set for force_original_aspect_ratio, increasing or decreasing the resolution accordingly. The video’s aspect ratio may be slightly modified.
This option can be handy if you need to have a video fit within or exceed a defined resolution using force_original_aspect_ratio but also have encoder restrictions on width or height divisibility.
Scale (resize) the input video, based on a reference video.

See the scale filter for available options, scale2ref supports the same but uses the reference video instead of the main input as basis. scale2ref also supports the following additional constants for the w and
h options:
name: scale2ref

parameters.name: main_w
description: The main input video’s width and height

parameters.name: main_h
description: The same as main_w / main_h

parameters.name: main_a
description: The main input video’s sample aspect ratio

parameters.name: main_sar
description: The main input video’s display aspect ratio. Calculated from
(main_w / main_h) * main_sar.

parameters.name: main_dar
description: The main input video’s horizontal and vertical chroma subsample values. For example for the pixel format "yuv422p" hsub is 2 and vsub is 1.

parameters.name: main_hsub
description: The (sequential) number of the main input frame, starting from 0. Only available with eval=frame.

parameters.name: main_vsub
description: The presentation timestamp of the main input frame, expressed as a number of seconds. Only available with eval=frame.

parameters.name: main_n
description: The position (byte offset) of the frame in the main input stream, or NaN if this information is unavailable and/or meaningless (for example in case of synthetic video). Only available with eval=frame.
Scroll input video horizontally and/or vertically by constant speed.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: scroll

parameters.name: horizontal
description: Set the horizontal scrolling speed. Default is 0. Allowed range is from -1 to 1. Negative values changes scrolling direction.

parameters.name: vertical
description: Set the vertical scrolling speed. Default is 0. Allowed range is from -1 to 1. Negative values changes scrolling direction.

parameters.name: hpos
description: Set the initial horizontal scrolling position. Default is 0. Allowed range is from 0 to 1.

parameters.name: vpos
description: Set the initial vertical scrolling position. Default is 0. Allowed range is from 0 to 1.

Adjust cyan, magenta, yellow and black (CMYK) to certain ranges of colors (such as "reds", "yellows", "greens", "cyans", ...). The adjustment range is defined by the "purity" of the color (that is, how saturated it already is).
This filter is similar to the Adobe Photoshop Selective Color tool.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: selectivecolor

parameters.name: correction_method
description: Select color correction method.
Available values are:
‘absolute’
Specified adjustments are applied "as-is" (added/subtracted to original pixel component value).
‘relative’
Specified adjustments are relative to the original component value.
Default is absolute.

parameters.name: reds
description: Adjustments for red pixels (pixels where the red component is the maximum)

parameters.name: yellows
description: Adjustments for yellow pixels (pixels where the blue component is the minimum)

parameters.name: greens
description: Adjustments for green pixels (pixels where the green component is the maximum)

parameters.name: cyans
description: Adjustments for cyan pixels (pixels where the red component is the minimum)

parameters.name: blues
description: Adjustments for blue pixels (pixels where the blue component is the maximum)

parameters.name: magentas
description: Adjustments for magenta pixels (pixels where the green component is the minimum)

parameters.name: whites
description: Adjustments for white pixels (pixels where all components are greater than 128)

parameters.name: neutrals
description: Adjustments for all pixels except pure black and pure white

parameters.name: blacks
description: Adjustments for black pixels (pixels where all components are lesser than 128)

parameters.name: psfile
description: Specify a Photoshop selective color file (.asv) to import the settings from.
The separatefields takes a frame-based video input and splits each frame into its components fields, producing a new half height clip with twice the frame rate and twice the frame count.
This filter use field-dominance information in frame to decide which of each pair of fields to place first in the output. If it gets it wrong use setfield filter before separatefields filter.
name: separatefields

description: The setdar filter sets the Display Aspect Ratio for the filter output video.
This is done by changing the specified Sample (aka Pixel) Aspect Ratio, according to the following equation:
DAR = HORIZONTAL_RESOLUTION / VERTICAL_RESOLUTION * SAR

Keep in mind that the setdar filter does not modify the pixel dimensions of the video frame. Also, the display aspect ratio set by this filter may be changed by later filters in the filterchain, e.g. in case of scaling or if another "setdar" or a "setsar" filter is applied.
The setsar filter sets the Sample (aka Pixel) Aspect Ratio for the filter output video.
Note that as a consequence of the application of this filter, the output display aspect ratio will change according to the equation above.
Keep in mind that the sample aspect ratio set by the setsar filter may be changed by later filters in the filterchain, e.g. if another "setsar" or a "setdar" filter is applied.
It accepts the following parameters:
name: setdar

parameters.name: r
description: Set the aspect ratio used by the filter.
The parameter can be a floating point number string, an expression, or a string of the form num:den, where num and
den are the numerator and denominator of the aspect ratio. If the parameter is not specified, it is assumed the value "0". In case the form "num:den" is used, the : character should be escaped.

parameters.name: max
description: Set the maximum integer value to use for expressing numerator and denominator when reducing the expressed aspect ratio to a rational. Default value is 100.
The setdar filter sets the Display Aspect Ratio for the filter output video.
This is done by changing the specified Sample (aka Pixel) Aspect Ratio, according to the following equation:
DAR = HORIZONTAL_RESOLUTION / VERTICAL_RESOLUTION * SAR

Keep in mind that the setdar filter does not modify the pixel dimensions of the video frame. Also, the display aspect ratio set by this filter may be changed by later filters in the filterchain, e.g. in case of scaling or if another "setdar" or a "setsar" filter is applied.
The setsar filter sets the Sample (aka Pixel) Aspect Ratio for the filter output video.
Note that as a consequence of the application of this filter, the output display aspect ratio will change according to the equation above.
Keep in mind that the sample aspect ratio set by the setsar filter may be changed by later filters in the filterchain, e.g. if another "setsar" or a "setdar" filter is applied.
It accepts the following parameters:
name: setsar

parameters.name: r
description: Set the aspect ratio used by the filter.
The parameter can be a floating point number string, an expression, or a string of the form num:den, where num and
den are the numerator and denominator of the aspect ratio. If the parameter is not specified, it is assumed the value "0". In case the form "num:den" is used, the : character should be escaped.

parameters.name: max
description: Set the maximum integer value to use for expressing numerator and denominator when reducing the expressed aspect ratio to a rational. Default value is 100.
Force field for the output video frame.

The setfield filter marks the interlace type field for the output frames. It does not change the input frame, but only sets the corresponding property, which affects how the frame is treated by following filters (e.g. fieldorder or yadif).
The filter accepts the following options:
name: setfield

parameters.name: mode
description: Available values are:
‘auto’
Keep the same field property.
‘bff’
Mark the frame as bottom-field-first.
‘tff’
Mark the frame as top-field-first.
‘prog’
Mark the frame as progressive.
Force frame parameter for the output video frame.

The setparams filter marks interlace and color range for the output frames. It does not change the input frame, but only sets the corresponding property, which affects how the frame is treated by filters/encoders.
name: setparams

parameters.name: field_mode
description: Available values are:
‘auto’
Keep the same field property (default).
‘bff’
Mark the frame as bottom-field-first.
‘tff’
Mark the frame as top-field-first.
‘prog’
Mark the frame as progressive.

parameters.name: range
description: Available values are:
‘auto’
Keep the same color range property (default).
‘unspecified, unknown’
Mark the frame as unspecified color range.
‘limited, tv, mpeg’
Mark the frame as limited range.
‘full, pc, jpeg’
Mark the frame as full range.

parameters.name: color_primaries
description: Set the color primaries. Available values are:
‘auto’
Keep the same color primaries property (default).
‘unknown’
‘bt470bg’
‘smpte170m’
‘smpte240m’
‘film’
‘smpte428’
‘smpte431’
‘smpte432’
‘jedec-p22’

parameters.name: color_trc
description: Set the color transfer. Available values are:
‘auto’
Keep the same color trc property (default).
‘unknown’
‘bt470bg’
‘smpte170m’
‘smpte240m’
‘linear’
‘smpte2084’
‘smpte428’
‘arib-std-b67’

parameters.name: colorspace
description: Set the colorspace. Available values are:
‘auto’
Keep the same colorspace property (default).
‘gbr’
‘unknown’
‘fcc’
‘bt470bg’
‘smpte170m’
‘smpte240m’
‘ycgco’
‘bt2020nc’
‘smpte2085’
‘chroma-derived-nc’
‘chroma-derived-c’
‘ictcp’

Evaluate various visual metrics that assist in determining issues associated with the digitization of analog video media.

parameters.name: YMIN
description: Display the minimal Y value contained within the input frame. Expressed in range of [0-255].

parameters.name: YLOW
description: Display the Y value at the 10% percentile within the input frame. Expressed in range of [0-255].

parameters.name: YAVG
description: Display the average Y value within the input frame. Expressed in range of [0-255].

parameters.name: YHIGH
description: Display the Y value at the 90% percentile within the input frame. Expressed in range of [0-255].

parameters.name: YMAX
description: Display the maximum Y value contained within the input frame. Expressed in range of [0-255].

parameters.name: UMIN
description: Display the minimal U value contained within the input frame. Expressed in range of [0-255].

parameters.name: ULOW
description: Display the U value at the 10% percentile within the input frame. Expressed in range of [0-255].

parameters.name: UAVG
description: Display the average U value within the input frame. Expressed in range of [0-255].

parameters.name: UHIGH
description: Display the U value at the 90% percentile within the input frame. Expressed in range of [0-255].

parameters.name: UMAX
description: Display the maximum U value contained within the input frame. Expressed in range of [0-255].

parameters.name: VMIN
description: Display the minimal V value contained within the input frame. Expressed in range of [0-255].

parameters.name: VLOW
description: Display the V value at the 10% percentile within the input frame. Expressed in range of [0-255].

parameters.name: VAVG
description: Display the average V value within the input frame. Expressed in range of [0-255].

parameters.name: VHIGH
description: Display the V value at the 90% percentile within the input frame. Expressed in range of [0-255].

parameters.name: VMAX
description: Display the maximum V value contained within the input frame. Expressed in range of [0-255].

parameters.name: SATMIN
description: Display the minimal saturation value contained within the input frame. Expressed in range of [0-~181.02].

parameters.name: SATLOW
description: Display the saturation value at the 10% percentile within the input frame. Expressed in range of [0-~181.02].

parameters.name: SATAVG
description: Display the average saturation value within the input frame. Expressed in range of [0-~181.02].

parameters.name: SATHIGH
description: Display the saturation value at the 90% percentile within the input frame. Expressed in range of [0-~181.02].

parameters.name: SATMAX
description: Display the maximum saturation value contained within the input frame. Expressed in range of [0-~181.02].

parameters.name: HUEMED
description: Display the median value for hue within the input frame. Expressed in range of [0-360].

parameters.name: HUEAVG
description: Display the average value for hue within the input frame. Expressed in range of [0-360].

parameters.name: YDIF
description: Display the average of sample value difference between all values of the Y plane in the current frame and corresponding values of the previous input frame. Expressed in range of [0-255].

parameters.name: UDIF
description: Display the average of sample value difference between all values of the U plane in the current frame and corresponding values of the previous input frame. Expressed in range of [0-255].

parameters.name: VDIF
description: Display the average of sample value difference between all values of the V plane in the current frame and corresponding values of the previous input frame. Expressed in range of [0-255].

parameters.name: YBITDEPTH
description: Display bit depth of Y plane in current frame. Expressed in range of [0-16].

parameters.name: UBITDEPTH
description: Display bit depth of U plane in current frame. Expressed in range of [0-16].

parameters.name: VBITDEPTH
description: Display bit depth of V plane in current frame. Expressed in range of [0-16].

Calculates the MPEG-7 Video Signature. The filter can handle more than one input. In this case the matching between the inputs can be calculated additionally. The filter always passes through the first input. The signature of each stream can be written into a file.
It accepts the following options:
name: signature

parameters.name: detectmode
description: Enable or disable the matching process.
Available values are:
‘off’
Disable the calculation of a matching (default).
‘full’
Calculate the matching for the whole video and output whether the whole video matches or only parts.
‘fast’
Calculate only until a matching is found or the video ends. Should be faster in some cases.

parameters.name: nb_inputs
description: Set the number of inputs. The option value must be a non negative integer. Default value is 1.

parameters.name: filename
description: Set the path to which the output is written. If there is more than one input, the path must be a prototype, i.e. must contain %d or %0nd (where n is a positive integer), that will be replaced with the input number. If no filename is specified, no output will be written. This is the default.

parameters.name: format
description: Choose the output format.
Available values are:
‘binary’
Use the specified binary representation (default).
‘xml’
Use the specified xml representation.

parameters.name: th_d
description: Set threshold to detect one word as similar. The option value must be an integer greater than zero. The default value is 9000.

parameters.name: th_dc
description: Set threshold to detect all words as similar. The option value must be an integer greater than zero. The default value is 60000.

parameters.name: th_xh
description: Set threshold to detect frames as similar. The option value must be an integer greater than zero. The default value is 116.

parameters.name: th_di
description: Set the minimum length of a sequence in frames to recognize it as matching sequence. The option value must be a non negative integer value. The default value is 0.

parameters.name: th_it
description: Set the minimum relation, that matching frames to all frames must have. The option value must be a double value between 0 and 1. The default value is 0.5.
Blur the input video without impacting the outlines.
It accepts the following options:
name: smartblur

parameters.name: luma_radius
description: Set the luma radius. The option value must be a float number in the range [0.1,5.0] that specifies the variance of the gaussian filter used to blur the image (slower if larger). Default value is 1.0.

parameters.name: luma_strength
description: Set the luma strength. The option value must be a float number in the range [-1.0,1.0] that configures the blurring. A value included in [0.0,1.0] will blur the image whereas a value included in [-1.0,0.0] will sharpen the image. Default value is 1.0.

parameters.name: luma_threshold
description: Set the luma threshold used as a coefficient to determine whether a pixel should be blurred or not. The option value must be an integer in the range [-30,30]. A value of 0 will filter all the image, a value included in [0,30] will filter flat areas and a value included in [-30,0] will filter edges. Default value is 0.

parameters.name: chroma_radius
description: Set the chroma radius. The option value must be a float number in the range [0.1,5.0] that specifies the variance of the gaussian filter used to blur the image (slower if larger). Default value is luma_radius.

parameters.name: chroma_strength
description: Set the chroma strength. The option value must be a float number in the range [-1.0,1.0] that configures the blurring. A value included in [0.0,1.0] will blur the image whereas a value included in [-1.0,0.0] will sharpen the image. Default value is luma_strength.

parameters.name: chroma_threshold
description: Set the chroma threshold used as a coefficient to determine whether a pixel should be blurred or not. The option value must be an integer in the range [-30,30]. A value of 0 will filter all the image, a value included in [0,30] will filter flat areas and a value included in [-30,0] will filter edges. Default value is luma_threshold.
Apply sobel operator to input video stream.
The filter accepts the following option:
name: sobel

parameters.name: planes
description: Set which planes will be processed, unprocessed planes will be copied. By default value 0xf, all planes will be processed.

parameters.name: scale
description: Set value which will be multiplied with filtered result.

parameters.name: delta
description: Set value which will be added to filtered result.
Apply a simple postprocessing filter that compresses and decompresses the image at several (or - in the case of quality level 6 - all) shifts and average the results.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: spp

parameters.name: quality
description: Set quality. This option defines the number of levels for averaging. It accepts an integer in the range 0-6. If set to 0, the filter will have no effect. A value of 6 means the higher quality. For each increment of that value the speed drops by a factor of approximately 2. Default value is

parameters.name: qp
description: Force a constant quantization parameter. If not set, the filter will use the QP from the video stream (if available).

parameters.name: mode
description: Set thresholding mode. Available modes are:
‘hard’
Set hard thresholding (default).
‘soft’
Set soft thresholding (better de-ringing effect, but likely blurrier).

parameters.name: use_bframe_qp
description: Enable the use of the QP from the B-Frames if set to 1. Using this option may cause flicker since the B-Frames have often larger QP. Default is
0 (not enabled).
Scale the input by applying one of the super-resolution methods based on convolutional neural networks. Supported models:
Super-Resolution Convolutional Neural Network model (SRCNN). See https://arxiv.org/abs/1501.00092.
Efficient Sub-Pixel Convolutional Neural Network model (ESPCN). See https://arxiv.org/abs/1609.05158.
Training scripts as well as scripts for model file (.pb) saving can be found at
https://github.com/XueweiMeng/sr/tree/sr_dnn_native. Original repository is at https://github.com/HighVoltageRocknRoll/sr.git.
Native model files (.model) can be generated from TensorFlow model files (.pb) by using tools/python/convert.py
The filter accepts the following options:
name: sr

parameters.name: dnn_backend
description: Specify which DNN backend to use for model loading and execution. This option accepts the following values:
‘native’
Native implementation of DNN loading and execution.
‘tensorflow’
TensorFlow backend. To enable this backend you need to install the TensorFlow for C library (see
https://www.tensorflow.org/install/install_c) and configure FFmpeg with
--enable-libtensorflow
Default value is ‘native’.

parameters.name: model
description: Set path to model file specifying network architecture and its parameters. Note that different backends use different file formats. TensorFlow backend can load files for both formats, while native backend can load files for only its format.

parameters.name: scale_factor
description: Set scale factor for SRCNN model. Allowed values are 2, 3 and 4. Default value is 2. Scale factor is necessary for SRCNN model, because it accepts input upscaled using bicubic upscaling with proper scale factor.
Obtain the SSIM (Structural SImilarity Metric) between two input videos.

This filter takes in input two input videos, the first input is considered the "main" source and is passed unchanged to the output. The second input is used as a "reference" video for computing the SSIM.
Both video inputs must have the same resolution and pixel format for this filter to work correctly. Also it assumes that both inputs have the same number of frames, which are compared one by one.
The filter stores the calculated SSIM of each frame.
The description of the accepted parameters follows.
name: ssim

parameters.name: stats_file
description: If specified the filter will use the named file to save the SSIM of each individual frame. When filename equals "-" the data is sent to standard output.
Convert between different stereoscopic image formats.
The filters accept the following options:
name: stereo3d

parameters.name: in
description: Set stereoscopic image format of input.
Available values for input image formats are:
‘sbsl’
side by side parallel (left eye left, right eye right)
‘sbsr’
side by side crosseye (right eye left, left eye right)
‘sbs2l’
side by side parallel with half width resolution (left eye left, right eye right)
‘sbs2r’
side by side crosseye with half width resolution (right eye left, left eye right)
‘abl’
‘tbl’
above-below (left eye above, right eye below)
‘abr’
‘tbr’
above-below (right eye above, left eye below)
‘ab2l’
‘tb2l’
above-below with half height resolution (left eye above, right eye below)
‘ab2r’
‘tb2r’
above-below with half height resolution (right eye above, left eye below)
‘al’
alternating frames (left eye first, right eye second)
‘ar’
alternating frames (right eye first, left eye second)
‘irl’
interleaved rows (left eye has top row, right eye starts on next row)
‘irr’
interleaved rows (right eye has top row, left eye starts on next row)
‘icl’
interleaved columns, left eye first
‘icr’
interleaved columns, right eye first
Default value is ‘sbsl’.

parameters.name: out
description: Set stereoscopic image format of output.
‘sbsl’
side by side parallel (left eye left, right eye right)
‘sbsr’
side by side crosseye (right eye left, left eye right)
‘sbs2l’
side by side parallel with half width resolution (left eye left, right eye right)
‘sbs2r’
side by side crosseye with half width resolution (right eye left, left eye right)
‘abl’
‘tbl’
above-below (left eye above, right eye below)
‘abr’
‘tbr’
above-below (right eye above, left eye below)
‘ab2l’
‘tb2l’
above-below with half height resolution (left eye above, right eye below)
‘ab2r’
‘tb2r’
above-below with half height resolution (right eye above, left eye below)
‘al’
alternating frames (left eye first, right eye second)
‘ar’
alternating frames (right eye first, left eye second)
‘irl’
interleaved rows (left eye has top row, right eye starts on next row)
‘irr’
interleaved rows (right eye has top row, left eye starts on next row)
‘arbg’
anaglyph red/blue gray (red filter on left eye, blue filter on right eye)
‘argg’
anaglyph red/green gray (red filter on left eye, green filter on right eye)
‘arcg’
anaglyph red/cyan gray (red filter on left eye, cyan filter on right eye)
‘arch’
anaglyph red/cyan half colored (red filter on left eye, cyan filter on right eye)
‘arcc’
anaglyph red/cyan color (red filter on left eye, cyan filter on right eye)
‘arcd’
anaglyph red/cyan color optimized with the least squares projection of dubois (red filter on left eye, cyan filter on right eye)
‘agmg’
anaglyph green/magenta gray (green filter on left eye, magenta filter on right eye)
‘agmh’
anaglyph green/magenta half colored (green filter on left eye, magenta filter on right eye)
‘agmc’
anaglyph green/magenta colored (green filter on left eye, magenta filter on right eye)
‘agmd’
anaglyph green/magenta color optimized with the least squares projection of dubois (green filter on left eye, magenta filter on right eye)
‘aybg’
anaglyph yellow/blue gray (yellow filter on left eye, blue filter on right eye)
‘aybh’
anaglyph yellow/blue half colored (yellow filter on left eye, blue filter on right eye)
‘aybc’
anaglyph yellow/blue colored (yellow filter on left eye, blue filter on right eye)
‘aybd’
anaglyph yellow/blue color optimized with the least squares projection of dubois (yellow filter on left eye, blue filter on right eye)
‘ml’
mono output (left eye only)
‘mr’
mono output (right eye only)
‘chl’
checkerboard, left eye first
‘chr’
checkerboard, right eye first
‘icl’
interleaved columns, left eye first
‘icr’
interleaved columns, right eye first
‘hdmi’
HDMI frame pack
Default value is ‘arcd’.
Select video or audio streams.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: streamselect

parameters.name: inputs
description: Set number of inputs. Default is 2.

parameters.name: map
description: Set input indexes to remap to outputs.
Select video or audio streams.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: astreamselect

parameters.name: inputs
description: Set number of inputs. Default is 2.

parameters.name: map
description: Set input indexes to remap to outputs.
Draw subtitles on top of input video using the libass library.
To enable compilation of this filter you need to configure FFmpeg with
--enable-libass. This filter also requires a build with libavcodec and libavformat to convert the passed subtitles file to ASS (Advanced Substation Alpha) subtitles format.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: subtitles

parameters.name: filename
description: Set the filename of the subtitle file to read. It must be specified.

parameters.name: original_size
description: Specify the size of the original video, the video for which the ASS file was composed. For the syntax of this option, check the
(ffmpeg-utils)"Video size" section in the ffmpeg-utils manual. Due to a misdesign in ASS aspect ratio arithmetic, this is necessary to correctly scale the fonts if the aspect ratio has been changed.

parameters.name: fontsdir
description: Set a directory path containing fonts that can be used by the filter. These fonts will be used in addition to whatever the font provider uses.

parameters.name: alpha
description: Process alpha channel, by default alpha channel is untouched.

parameters.name: charenc
description: Set subtitles input character encoding. subtitles filter only. Only useful if not UTF-8.

parameters.name: stream_index
description: Set subtitles stream index. subtitles filter only.

parameters.name: force_style
description: Override default style or script info parameters of the subtitles. It accepts a string containing ASS style format KEY=VALUE couples separated by ",".
Scale the input by 2x and smooth using the Super2xSaI (Scale and Interpolate) pixel art scaling algorithm.
Useful for enlarging pixel art images without reducing sharpness.
name: super2xsai

description: Swap two rectangular objects in video.
This filter accepts the following options:
name: swaprect

parameters.name: w
description: Set object width.

parameters.name: h
description: Set object height.

parameters.name: x1
description: Set 1st rect x coordinate.

parameters.name: y1
description: Set 1st rect y coordinate.

parameters.name: x2
description: Set 2nd rect x coordinate.

parameters.name: y2
description: Set 2nd rect y coordinate.
All expressions are evaluated once for each frame.
Swap U & V plane.
name: swapuv

description: Apply telecine process to the video.
This filter accepts the following options:
name: telecine

parameters.name: first_field
description: ‘top, t’
top field first
‘bottom, b’
bottom field first The default value is top.

parameters.name: pattern
description: A string of numbers representing the pulldown pattern you wish to apply. The default value is 23.
Compute and draw a color distribution histogram for the input video across time.
Unlike histogram video filter which only shows histogram of single input frame at certain time, this filter shows also past histograms of number of frames defined by width option.
The computed histogram is a representation of the color component distribution in an image.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: thistogram

parameters.name: width
description: Set width of single color component output. Default value is 0. Value of 0 means width will be picked from input video. This also set number of passed histograms to keep. Allowed range is [0, 8192].

parameters.name: display_mode
description: Set display mode. It accepts the following values:
‘stack’
Per color component graphs are placed below each other.
‘parade’
Per color component graphs are placed side by side.
‘overlay’
Presents information identical to that in the parade, except that the graphs representing color components are superimposed directly over one another.
Default is stack.

parameters.name: levels_mode
description: Set mode. Can be either linear, or logarithmic. Default is linear.

parameters.name: components
description: Set what color components to display. Default is 7.

parameters.name: bgopacity
description: Set background opacity. Default is 0.9.

parameters.name: envelope
description: Show envelope. Default is disabled.

parameters.name: ecolor
description: Set envelope color. Default is gold.
Apply threshold effect to video stream.

This filter needs four video streams to perform thresholding. First stream is stream we are filtering. Second stream is holding threshold values, third stream is holding min values, and last, fourth stream is holding max values.
The filter accepts the following option:
name: threshold

parameters.name: planes
description: Set which planes will be processed, unprocessed planes will be copied. By default value 0xf, all planes will be processed.
Select the most representative frame in a given sequence of consecutive frames.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: thumbnail

parameters.name: n
description: Set the frames batch size to analyze; in a set of n frames, the filter will pick one of them, and then handle the next batch of n frames until the end. Default is 100.
Tile several successive frames together.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: tile

parameters.name: layout
description: Set the grid size (i.e. the number of lines and columns). For the syntax of this option, check the
(ffmpeg-utils)"Video size" section in the ffmpeg-utils manual.

parameters.name: nb_frames
description: Set the maximum number of frames to render in the given area. It must be less than or equal to wxh. The default value is 0, meaning all the area will be used.

parameters.name: margin
description: Set the outer border margin in pixels.

parameters.name: padding
description: Set the inner border thickness (i.e. the number of pixels between frames). For more advanced padding options (such as having different values for the edges), refer to the pad video filter.

parameters.name: color
description: Specify the color of the unused area. For the syntax of this option, check the
(ffmpeg-utils)"Color" section in the ffmpeg-utils manual. The default value of color is "black".

parameters.name: overlap
description: Set the number of frames to overlap when tiling several successive frames together. The value must be between 0 and nb_frames - 1.

parameters.name: init_padding
description: Set the number of frames to initially be empty before displaying first output frame. This controls how soon will one get first output frame. The value must be between 0 and nb_frames - 1.
Perform various types of temporal field interlacing.
Frames are counted starting from 1, so the first input frame is considered odd.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: tinterlace

parameters.name: mode
description: Specify the mode of the interlacing. This option can also be specified as a value alone. See below for a list of values for this option.
Available values are:
‘merge, 0’
Move odd frames into the upper field, even into the lower field, generating a double height frame at half frame rate.
Input:
Frame 1         Frame 2         Frame 3         Frame 4
Output:
‘drop_even, 1’
Only output odd frames, even frames are dropped, generating a frame with unchanged height at half frame rate.
Input:
Frame 1         Frame 2         Frame 3         Frame 4
Output:
‘drop_odd, 2’
Only output even frames, odd frames are dropped, generating a frame with unchanged height at half frame rate.
Input:
Frame 1         Frame 2         Frame 3         Frame 4
Output:
‘pad, 3’
Expand each frame to full height, but pad alternate lines with black, generating a frame with double height at the same input frame rate.
Input:
Frame 1         Frame 2         Frame 3         Frame 4
Output:
‘interleave_top, 4’
Interleave the upper field from odd frames with the lower field from even frames, generating a frame with unchanged height at half frame rate.
Input:
Frame 1         Frame 2         Frame 3         Frame 4
Output:
‘interleave_bottom, 5’
Interleave the lower field from odd frames with the upper field from even frames, generating a frame with unchanged height at half frame rate.
Input:
Frame 1         Frame 2         Frame 3         Frame 4
Output:
‘interlacex2, 6’

Double frame rate with unchanged height. Frames are inserted each containing the second temporal field from the previous input frame and the first temporal field from the next input frame. This mode relies on the top_field_first flag. Useful for interlaced video displays with no field synchronisation.
Input:
Frame 1         Frame 2         Frame 3         Frame 4
Output:
‘mergex2, 7’
Move odd frames into the upper field, even into the lower field, generating a double height frame at same frame rate.
Input:
Frame 1         Frame 2         Frame 3         Frame 4
Output:
Numeric values are deprecated but are accepted for backward compatibility reasons.
Default mode is merge.

parameters.name: flags
description: Specify flags influencing the filter process.
Available value for flags is:
low_pass_filter, vlpf

Enable linear vertical low-pass filtering in the filter. Vertical low-pass filtering is required when creating an interlaced destination from a progressive source which contains high-frequency vertical detail. Filtering will reduce interlace ’twitter’ and Moire patterning.
complex_filter, cvlpf
Enable complex vertical low-pass filtering. This will slightly less reduce interlace ’twitter’ and Moire patterning but better retain detail and subjective sharpness impression.
bypass_il
Bypass already interlaced frames, only adjust the frame rate.
Vertical low-pass filtering and bypassing already interlaced frames can only be enabled for mode interleave_top and interleave_bottom.
Mix successive video frames.
A description of the accepted options follows.
name: tmix

parameters.name: frames
description: The number of successive frames to mix. If unspecified, it defaults to 3.

parameters.name: weights
description: Specify weight of each input video frame. Each weight is separated by space. If number of weights is smaller than number of frames last specified weight will be used for all remaining unset weights.

parameters.name: scale
description: Specify scale, if it is set it will be multiplied with sum of each weight multiplied with pixel values to give final destination pixel value. By default scale is auto scaled to sum of weights.
Tone map colors from different dynamic ranges.
This filter expects data in single precision floating point, as it needs to operate on (and can output) out-of-range values. Another filter, such as
zscale, is needed to convert the resulting frame to a usable format.
The tonemapping algorithms implemented only work on linear light, so input data should be linearized beforehand (and possibly correctly tagged).
ffmpeg -i INPUT -vf zscale=transfer=linear,tonemap=clip,zscale=transfer=bt709,format=yuv420p OUTPUT
name: tonemap

description: Temporarily pad video frames.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: tpad

parameters.name: start
description: Specify number of delay frames before input video stream.

parameters.name: stop
description: Specify number of padding frames after input video stream. Set to -1 to pad indefinitely.

parameters.name: start_mode
description: Set kind of frames added to beginning of stream. Can be either add or clone. With add frames of solid-color are added. With clone frames are clones of first frame.

parameters.name: stop_mode
description: Set kind of frames added to end of stream. Can be either add or clone. With add frames of solid-color are added. With clone frames are clones of last frame.

parameters.name: start_duration
description: Specify the duration of the start/stop delay. See
(ffmpeg-utils)the Time duration section in the ffmpeg-utils(1) manual for the accepted syntax. These options override start and stop.

parameters.name: color
description: Specify the color of the padded area. For the syntax of this option, check the (ffmpeg-utils)"Color" section in the ffmpeg-utils
manual.
The default value of color is "black".
Transpose rows with columns in the input video and optionally flip it.
It accepts the following parameters:
name: transpose

parameters.name: dir
description: Specify the transposition direction.
Can assume the following values:
‘0, 4, cclock_flip’
Rotate by 90 degrees counterclockwise and vertically flip (default), that is:
L.R     L.l
l.r     R.r
‘1, 5, clock’
Rotate by 90 degrees clockwise, that is:
L.R     l.L
l.r     r.R
‘2, 6, cclock’
Rotate by 90 degrees counterclockwise, that is:
L.R     R.r
l.r     L.l
‘3, 7, clock_flip’
Rotate by 90 degrees clockwise and vertically flip, that is:
L.R     r.R
l.r     l.L
For values between 4-7, the transposition is only done if the input video geometry is portrait and not landscape. These values are deprecated, the passthrough option should be used instead.
Numerical values are deprecated, and should be dropped in favor of symbolic constants.

parameters.name: passthrough
description: Do not apply the transposition if the input geometry matches the one specified by the specified value. It accepts the following values:
‘none’
Always apply transposition.
‘portrait’
Preserve portrait geometry (when height >= width).
‘landscape’
Preserve landscape geometry (when width >= height).
Default value is none.
Transpose rows with columns in the input video and optionally flip it. For more in depth examples see the transpose video filter, which shares mostly the same options.
It accepts the following parameters:
name: transpose_npp

parameters.name: dir
description: Specify the transposition direction.
Can assume the following values:
‘cclock_flip’
Rotate by 90 degrees counterclockwise and vertically flip. (default)
‘clock’
Rotate by 90 degrees clockwise.
‘cclock’
Rotate by 90 degrees counterclockwise.
‘clock_flip’
Rotate by 90 degrees clockwise and vertically flip.

parameters.name: passthrough
description: Do not apply the transposition if the input geometry matches the one specified by the specified value. It accepts the following values:
‘none’
Always apply transposition. (default)
‘portrait’
Preserve portrait geometry (when height >= width).
‘landscape’
Preserve landscape geometry (when width >= height).
Trim the input so that the output contains one continuous subpart of the input.
It accepts the following parameters:
name: trim

parameters.name: start
description: Specify the time of the start of the kept section, i.e. the frame with the timestamp start will be the first frame in the output.

parameters.name: end
description: Specify the time of the first frame that will be dropped, i.e. the frame immediately preceding the one with the timestamp end will be the last frame in the output.

parameters.name: start_pts
description: This is the same as start, except this option sets the start timestamp in timebase units instead of seconds.

parameters.name: end_pts
description: This is the same as end, except this option sets the end timestamp in timebase units instead of seconds.

parameters.name: duration
description: The maximum duration of the output in seconds.

parameters.name: start_frame
description: The number of the first frame that should be passed to the output.

parameters.name: end_frame
description: The number of the first frame that should be dropped.
Apply alpha unpremultiply effect to input video stream using first plane of second stream as alpha.
Both streams must have same dimensions and same pixel format.
The filter accepts the following option:
name: unpremultiply

parameters.name: planes
description: Set which planes will be processed, unprocessed planes will be copied. By default value 0xf, all planes will be processed.

If the format has 1 or 2 components, then luma is bit 0. If the format has 3 or 4 components: for RGB formats bit 0 is green, bit 1 is blue and bit 2 is red; for YUV formats bit 0 is luma, bit 1 is chroma-U and bit 2 is chroma-V. If present, the alpha channel is always the last bit.

parameters.name: inplace
description: Do not require 2nd input for processing, instead use alpha plane from input stream.
Sharpen or blur the input video.
It accepts the following parameters:
name: unsharp

parameters.name: luma_msize_x
description: Set the luma matrix horizontal size. It must be an odd integer between 3 and 23. The default value is 5.

parameters.name: luma_msize_y
description: Set the luma matrix vertical size. It must be an odd integer between 3 and 23. The default value is 5.

parameters.name: luma_amount
description: Set the luma effect strength. It must be a floating point number, reasonable values lay between -1.5 and 1.5.
Negative values will blur the input video, while positive values will sharpen it, a value of zero will disable the effect.
Default value is 1.0.

parameters.name: chroma_msize_x
description: Set the chroma matrix horizontal size. It must be an odd integer between 3 and 23. The default value is 5.

parameters.name: chroma_msize_y
description: Set the chroma matrix vertical size. It must be an odd integer between 3 and 23. The default value is 5.

parameters.name: chroma_amount
description: Set the chroma effect strength. It must be a floating point number, reasonable values lay between -1.5 and 1.5.
Negative values will blur the input video, while positive values will sharpen it, a value of zero will disable the effect.
Default value is 0.0.
Apply ultra slow/simple postprocessing filter that compresses and decompresses the image at several (or - in the case of quality level 8 - all) shifts and average the results.
The way this differs from the behavior of spp is that uspp actually encodes & decodes each case with libavcodec Snow, whereas spp uses a simplified intra only 8x8 DCT similar to MJPEG.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: uspp

parameters.name: quality
description: Set quality. This option defines the number of levels for averaging. It accepts an integer in the range 0-8. If set to 0, the filter will have no effect. A value of 8 means the higher quality. For each increment of that value the speed drops by a factor of approximately 2. Default value is

parameters.name: qp
description: Force a constant quantization parameter. If not set, the filter will use the QP from the video stream (if available).
Convert 360 videos between various formats.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: v360

parameters.name: input
description: Set format of the input/output video.
Available formats:
‘equirect’
Equirectangular projection.
Cubemap with 3x2/6x1/1x6 layout.
Format specific options:
in_pad
out_pad
Set padding proportion for the input/output cubemap. Values in decimals.
Example values:
No padding.
1% of face is padding. For example, with 1920x1280 resolution face size would be 640x640 and padding would be 3 pixels from each side. (640 * 0.01 = 6 pixels)
Default value is ‘0’.
fin_pad
fout_pad
Set fixed padding for the input/output cubemap. Values in pixels.
Default value is ‘0’. If greater than zero it overrides other padding options.
in_forder
out_forder
Set order of faces for the input/output cubemap. Choose one direction for each position.
Designation of directions:
right
left
up
down
forward
back
Default value is ‘rludfb’.
in_frot
out_frot
Set rotation of faces for the input/output cubemap. Choose one angle for each position.
Designation of angles:
0 degrees clockwise
90 degrees clockwise
180 degrees clockwise
270 degrees clockwise
Default value is ‘000000’.
‘eac’
Equi-Angular Cubemap.
‘flat’
‘gnomonic’

Regular video.

in_pad
out_pad
Set padding proportion. Values in decimals.
Example values:
No padding.
1% padding.
Default value is ‘0’.
‘barrel’

Facebook’s 360 format.

Stereographic format.
Format specific options:
h_fov
v_fov

Set output horizontal/vertical/diagonal field of view. Values in degrees.
If diagonal field of view is set it overrides horizontal and vertical field of view.
ih_fov
iv_fov

Set input horizontal/vertical/diagonal field of view. Values in degrees.
If diagonal field of view is set it overrides horizontal and vertical field of view.
‘mercator’
Mercator format.
‘ball’
Ball format, gives significant distortion toward the back.
‘hammer’
Hammer-Aitoff map projection format.
‘sinusoidal’
Sinusoidal map projection format.

Fisheye projection.
Format specific options:
h_fov

d_fov

If diagonal field of view is set it overrides horizontal and vertical field of view.

‘pannini’

Set pannini parameter.
‘cylindrical’
Cylindrical projection.
