setpts works on video frames, asetpts on audio frames.
This filter accepts the following options:
name: setpts

parameters.name: expr
description: The expression which is evaluated for each frame to construct its timestamp.
Change the PTS (presentation timestamp) of the input frames.
setpts works on video frames, asetpts on audio frames.
This filter accepts the following options:
name: asetpts

parameters.name: expr
description: The expression which is evaluated for each frame to construct its timestamp.
Force color range for the output video frame.

The setrange filter marks the color range property for the output frames. It does not change the input frame, but only sets the corresponding property, which affects how the frame is treated by following filters.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: setrange

parameters.name: range
description: Available values are:
‘auto’
Keep the same color range property.
‘unspecified, unknown’
Set the color range as unspecified.
‘limited, tv, mpeg’
Set the color range as limited.
‘full, pc, jpeg’
Set the color range as full.
Set the timebase to use for the output frames timestamps. It is mainly useful for testing timebase configuration.
It accepts the following parameters:
name: settb

parameters.name: expr
description: The expression which is evaluated into the output timebase.
Set the timebase to use for the output frames timestamps. It is mainly useful for testing timebase configuration.
It accepts the following parameters:
name: asettb

parameters.name: expr
description: The expression which is evaluated into the output timebase.

Convert input audio to a video output representing frequency spectrum logarithmically using Brown-Puckette constant Q transform algorithm with direct frequency domain coefficient calculation (but the transform itself is not really constant Q, instead the Q factor is actually variable/clamped), with musical tone scale, from E0 to D#10.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: showcqt

parameters.name: size
description: Specify the video size for the output. It must be even. For the syntax of this option, check the (ffmpeg-utils)"Video size" section in the ffmpeg-utils manual. Default value is 1920x1080.

parameters.name: fps
description: Set the output frame rate. Default value is 25.

parameters.name: bar_h
description: Set the bargraph height. It must be even. Default value is -1 which computes the bargraph height automatically.

parameters.name: axis_h
description: Set the axis height. It must be even. Default value is -1 which computes the axis height automatically.

parameters.name: sono_h
description: Set the sonogram height. It must be even. Default value is -1 which computes the sonogram height automatically.

parameters.name: fullhd
description: Set the fullhd resolution. This option is deprecated, use size, s instead. Default value is 1.

parameters.name: sono_v
description: Specify the sonogram volume expression. It can contain variables:
bar_v
the bar_v evaluated expression
frequency, freq, f
the frequency where it is evaluated
timeclamp, tc
the value of timeclamp option
and functions:
a_weighting(f)
A-weighting of equal loudness
b_weighting(f)
B-weighting of equal loudness
c_weighting(f)
C-weighting of equal loudness.
Default value is 16.

parameters.name: bar_v
description: Specify the bargraph volume expression. It can contain variables:
sono_v
the sono_v evaluated expression
frequency, freq, f
the frequency where it is evaluated
timeclamp, tc
the value of timeclamp option
and functions:
a_weighting(f)
A-weighting of equal loudness
b_weighting(f)
B-weighting of equal loudness
c_weighting(f)
C-weighting of equal loudness.
Default value is sono_v.

parameters.name: sono_g
description: Specify the sonogram gamma. Lower gamma makes the spectrum more contrast, higher gamma makes the spectrum having more range. Default value is 3. Acceptable range is [1, 7].

parameters.name: bar_g
description: Specify the bargraph gamma. Default value is 1. Acceptable range is

parameters.name: bar_t
description: Specify the bargraph transparency level. Lower value makes the bargraph sharper. Default value is 1. Acceptable range is [0, 1].

parameters.name: timeclamp
description: Specify the transform timeclamp. At low frequency, there is trade-off between accuracy in time domain and frequency domain. If timeclamp is lower, event in time domain is represented more accurately (such as fast bass drum), otherwise event in frequency domain is represented more accurately (such as bass guitar). Acceptable range is [0.002, 1]. Default value is 0.17.

parameters.name: attack
description: Set attack time in seconds. The default is 0 (disabled). Otherwise, it limits future samples by applying asymmetric windowing in time domain, useful when low latency is required. Accepted range is [0, 1].

parameters.name: basefreq
description: Specify the transform base frequency. Default value is 20.01523126408007475, which is frequency 50 cents below E0. Acceptable range is [10, 100000].

parameters.name: endfreq
description: Specify the transform end frequency. Default value is 20495.59681441799654, which is frequency 50 cents above D#10. Acceptable range is [10, 100000].

parameters.name: coeffclamp
description: This option is deprecated and ignored.

parameters.name: tlength
description: Specify the transform length in time domain. Use this option to control accuracy trade-off between time domain and frequency domain at every frequency sample. It can contain variables:
frequency, freq, f
the frequency where it is evaluated
timeclamp, tc
the value of timeclamp option.
Default value is 384*tc/(384+tc*f).

parameters.name: count
description: Specify the transform count for every video frame. Default value is 6. Acceptable range is [1, 30].

parameters.name: fcount
description: Specify the transform count for every single pixel. Default value is 0, which makes it computed automatically. Acceptable range is [0, 10].

parameters.name: fontfile
description: Specify font file for use with freetype to draw the axis. If not specified, use embedded font. Note that drawing with font file or embedded font is not implemented with custom basefreq and endfreq, use axisfile option instead.

parameters.name: font
description: Specify fontconfig pattern. This has lower priority than fontfile. The
: in the pattern may be replaced by | to avoid unnecessary escaping.

parameters.name: fontcolor
description: Specify font color expression. This is arithmetic expression that should return integer value 0xRRGGBB. It can contain variables:
frequency, freq, f
the frequency where it is evaluated
timeclamp, tc
the value of timeclamp option
and functions:
midi(f)
midi number of frequency f, some midi numbers: E0(16), C1(24), C2(36), A4(69)
r(x), g(x), b(x)
red, green, and blue value of intensity x.
Default value is st(0, (midi(f)-59.5)/12);

parameters.name: axisfile
description: Specify image file to draw the axis. This option override fontfile and
fontcolor option.

parameters.name: axis
description: Enable/disable drawing text to the axis. If it is set to 0, drawing to the axis is disabled, ignoring fontfile and axisfile option. Default value is 1.

parameters.name: csp
description: Set colorspace. The accepted values are:
‘unspecified’
Unspecified (default)
‘fcc’
FCC
‘bt470bg’
‘smpte170m’
SMPTE-170M or BT.601-6 525
‘smpte240m’
SMPTE-240M
‘bt2020ncl’
BT.2020 with non-constant luminance

parameters.name: cscheme
description: Set spectrogram color scheme. This is list of floating point values with format
left_r|left_g|left_b|right_r|right_g|right_b. The default is 1|0.5|0|0|0.5|1.
Convert input audio to video output representing the audio power spectrum. Audio amplitude is on Y-axis while frequency is on X-axis.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: showfreqs

parameters.name: size
description: Specify size of video. For the syntax of this option, check the
(ffmpeg-utils)"Video size" section in the ffmpeg-utils manual. Default is 1024x512.

parameters.name: mode
description: Set display mode. This set how each frequency bin will be represented.
It accepts the following values:
‘line’
‘bar’
‘dot’
Default is bar.

parameters.name: ascale
description: Set amplitude scale.
It accepts the following values:
‘lin’
Linear scale.
‘sqrt’
Square root scale.
‘cbrt’
Cubic root scale.
‘log’
Logarithmic scale.
Default is log.

parameters.name: fscale
description: Set frequency scale.
It accepts the following values:
‘lin’
Linear scale.
‘log’
Logarithmic scale.
‘rlog’
Reverse logarithmic scale.
Default is lin.

parameters.name: win_size
description: Set window size. Allowed range is from 16 to 65536.
Default is 2048

parameters.name: win_func
description: Set windowing function.
It accepts the following values:
‘rect’
‘bartlett’
‘hanning’
‘hamming’
‘blackman’
‘welch’
‘flattop’
‘bharris’
‘bnuttall’
‘bhann’
‘sine’
‘nuttall’
‘lanczos’
‘gauss’
‘tukey’
‘dolph’
‘cauchy’
‘parzen’
‘poisson’
‘bohman’
Default is hanning.

parameters.name: overlap
description: Set window overlap. In range [0, 1]. Default is 1, which means optimal overlap for selected window function will be picked.

parameters.name: averaging
description: Set time averaging. Setting this to 0 will display current maximal peaks. Default is 1, which means time averaging is disabled.

parameters.name: colors
description: Specify list of colors separated by space or by ’|’ which will be used to draw channel frequencies. Unrecognized or missing colors will be replaced by white color.

parameters.name: cmode
description: Set channel display mode.
It accepts the following values:
‘combined’
‘separate’
Default is combined.

parameters.name: minamp
description: Set minimum amplitude used in log amplitude scaler.
Convert stereo input audio to a video output, representing the spatial relationship between two channels.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: showspatial

parameters.name: size
description: Specify the video size for the output. For the syntax of this option, check the
(ffmpeg-utils)"Video size" section in the ffmpeg-utils manual. Default value is 512x512.

parameters.name: win_size
description: Set window size. Allowed range is from 1024 to 65536. Default size is 4096.

parameters.name: win_func
description: Set window function.
It accepts the following values:
‘rect’
‘bartlett’
‘hann’
‘hanning’
‘hamming’
‘blackman’
‘welch’
‘flattop’
‘bharris’
‘bnuttall’
‘bhann’
‘sine’
‘nuttall’
‘lanczos’
‘gauss’
‘tukey’
‘dolph’
‘cauchy’
‘parzen’
‘poisson’
‘bohman’
Default value is hann.

parameters.name: overlap
description: Set ratio of overlap window. Default value is 0.5. When value is 1 overlap is set to recommended size for specific window function currently used.
Convert input audio to a video output, representing the audio frequency spectrum.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: showspectrum

parameters.name: size
description: Specify the video size for the output. For the syntax of this option, check the
(ffmpeg-utils)"Video size" section in the ffmpeg-utils manual. Default value is 640x512.

parameters.name: slide
description: Specify how the spectrum should slide along the window.
It accepts the following values:
‘replace’
the samples start again on the left when they reach the right
‘scroll’
the samples scroll from right to left
‘fullframe’
frames are only produced when the samples reach the right
‘rscroll’
the samples scroll from left to right
Default value is replace.

parameters.name: mode
description: Specify display mode.
It accepts the following values:
‘combined’
all channels are displayed in the same row
‘separate’
all channels are displayed in separate rows
Default value is ‘combined’.

parameters.name: color
description: Specify display color mode.
It accepts the following values:
‘channel’
each channel is displayed in a separate color
‘intensity’
each channel is displayed using the same color scheme
‘rainbow’
each channel is displayed using the rainbow color scheme
‘moreland’
each channel is displayed using the moreland color scheme
‘nebulae’
each channel is displayed using the nebulae color scheme
‘fire’
each channel is displayed using the fire color scheme
‘fiery’
each channel is displayed using the fiery color scheme
‘fruit’
each channel is displayed using the fruit color scheme
‘cool’
each channel is displayed using the cool color scheme
‘magma’
each channel is displayed using the magma color scheme
‘green’
each channel is displayed using the green color scheme
‘viridis’
each channel is displayed using the viridis color scheme
‘plasma’
each channel is displayed using the plasma color scheme
‘cividis’
each channel is displayed using the cividis color scheme
‘terrain’
each channel is displayed using the terrain color scheme
Default value is ‘channel’.

parameters.name: scale
description: Specify scale used for calculating intensity color values.
It accepts the following values:
‘lin’
linear
‘sqrt’
square root, default
‘cbrt’
cubic root
‘log’
logarithmic
‘4thrt’
4th root
‘5thrt’
5th root
Default value is ‘sqrt’.

parameters.name: fscale
description: Specify frequency scale.
It accepts the following values:
‘lin’
linear
‘log’
logarithmic
Default value is ‘lin’.

parameters.name: saturation
description: Set saturation modifier for displayed colors. Negative values provide alternative color scheme. 0 is no saturation at all. Saturation must be in [-10.0, 10.0] range. Default value is 1.

parameters.name: win_func
description: Set window function.
It accepts the following values:
‘rect’
‘bartlett’
‘hann’
‘hanning’
‘hamming’
‘blackman’
‘welch’
‘flattop’
‘bharris’
‘bnuttall’
‘bhann’
‘sine’
‘nuttall’
‘lanczos’
‘gauss’
‘tukey’
‘dolph’
‘cauchy’
‘parzen’
‘poisson’
‘bohman’
Default value is hann.

parameters.name: orientation
description: Set orientation of time vs frequency axis. Can be vertical or
horizontal. Default is vertical.

parameters.name: overlap
description: Set ratio of overlap window. Default value is 0. When value is 1 overlap is set to recommended size for specific window function currently used.

parameters.name: gain
description: Set scale gain for calculating intensity color values. Default value is 1.

parameters.name: data
description: Set which data to display. Can be magnitude, default or phase.

parameters.name: rotation
description: Set color rotation, must be in [-1.0, 1.0] range. Default value is 0.

parameters.name: start
description: Set start frequency from which to display spectrogram. Default is 0.

parameters.name: stop
description: Set stop frequency to which to display spectrogram. Default is 0.

parameters.name: fps
description: Set upper frame rate limit. Default is auto, unlimited.

parameters.name: legend
description: Draw time and frequency axes and legends. Default is disabled.

Convert input audio volume to a video output.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: showvolume

parameters.name: rate
description: Set video rate.

parameters.name: b
description: Set border width, allowed range is [0, 5]. Default is 1.

parameters.name: w
description: Set channel width, allowed range is [80, 8192]. Default is 400.

parameters.name: h
description: Set channel height, allowed range is [1, 900]. Default is 20.

parameters.name: f
description: Set fade, allowed range is [0, 1]. Default is 0.95.

parameters.name: c
description: Set volume color expression.
The expression can use the following variables:
VOLUME
Current max volume of channel in dB.
PEAK
Current peak.
CHANNEL
Current channel number, starting from 0.

parameters.name: t
description: If set, displays channel names. Default is enabled.

parameters.name: v
description: If set, displays volume values. Default is enabled.

parameters.name: o
description: Set orientation, can be horizontal: h or vertical: v, default is h.

parameters.name: s
description: Set step size, allowed range is [0, 5]. Default is 0, which means step is disabled.

parameters.name: p
description: Set background opacity, allowed range is [0, 1]. Default is 0.

parameters.name: m
description: Set metering mode, can be peak: p or rms: r, default is p.

parameters.name: ds
description: Set display scale, can be linear: lin or log: log, default is lin.

parameters.name: dm
description: In second. If set to > 0., display a line for the max level in the previous seconds. default is disabled: 0.

parameters.name: dmc
description: The color of the max line. Use when dm option is set to > 0. default is: orange
Convert input audio to a video output, representing the samples waves.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: showwaves

parameters.name: size
description: Specify the video size for the output. For the syntax of this option, check the
(ffmpeg-utils)"Video size" section in the ffmpeg-utils manual. Default value is 600x240.

parameters.name: mode
description: Set display mode.
Available values are:
‘point’
Draw a point for each sample.
‘line’
Draw a vertical line for each sample.
‘p2p’
Draw a point for each sample and a line between them.
‘cline’
Draw a centered vertical line for each sample.
Default value is point.

parameters.name: n
description: Set the number of samples which are printed on the same column. A larger value will decrease the frame rate. Must be a positive integer. This option can be set only if the value for rate is not explicitly specified.

parameters.name: rate
description: Set the (approximate) output frame rate. This is done by setting the option n. Default value is "25".

parameters.name: split_channels
description: Set if channels should be drawn separately or overlap. Default value is 0.

parameters.name: colors
description: Set colors separated by ’|’ which are going to be used for drawing of each channel.

parameters.name: scale
description: Set amplitude scale.
Available values are:
‘lin’
Linear.
‘log’
Logarithmic.
‘sqrt’
Square root.
‘cbrt’
Cubic root.
Default is linear.

parameters.name: draw
description: Set the draw mode. This is mostly useful to set for high n.
Available values are:
‘scale’
Scale pixel values for each drawn sample.
‘full’
Draw every sample directly.
Default value is scale.
Convert input audio to a single video frame, representing the samples waves.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: showwavespic

Delete frame side data, or select frames based on it.
This filter accepts the following options:
name: sidedata

parameters.name: mode
description: Set mode of operation of the filter.
Can be one of the following:
‘select’
Select every frame with side data of type.
‘delete’
Delete side data of type. If type is not set, delete all side data in the frame.

parameters.name: type
description: Set side data type used with all modes. Must be set for select mode. For the list of frame side data types, refer to the AVFrameSideDataType enum in libavutil/frame.h. For example, to choose
AV_FRAME_DATA_PANSCAN side data, you must specify PANSCAN.
Delete frame side data, or select frames based on it.
This filter accepts the following options:
name: asidedata

parameters.name: mode
description: Set mode of operation of the filter.
Can be one of the following:
‘select’
Select every frame with side data of type.
‘delete’
Delete side data of type. If type is not set, delete all side data in the frame.

parameters.name: type
description: Set side data type used with all modes. Must be set for select mode. For the list of frame side data types, refer to the AVFrameSideDataType enum in libavutil/frame.h. For example, to choose
AV_FRAME_DATA_PANSCAN side data, you must specify PANSCAN.

Synthesize audio from 2 input video spectrums, first input stream represents magnitude across time and second represents phase across time. The filter will transform from frequency domain as displayed in videos back to time domain as presented in audio output.

This filter is primarily created for reversing processed showspectrum filter outputs, but can synthesize sound from other spectrograms too. But in such case results are going to be poor if the phase data is not available, because in such cases phase data need to be recreated, usually it’s just recreated from random noise. For best results use gray only output (channel color mode in
showspectrum filter) and log scale for magnitude video and
lin scale for phase video. To produce phase, for 2nd video, use
data option. Inputs videos should generally use fullframe slide mode as that saves resources needed for decoding video.
The filter accepts the following options:
name: spectrumsynth

parameters.name: sample_rate
description: Specify sample rate of output audio, the sample rate of audio from which spectrum was generated may differ.

parameters.name: channels
description: Set number of channels represented in input video spectrums.

parameters.name: scale
description: Set scale which was used when generating magnitude input spectrum. Can be lin or log. Default is log.

parameters.name: slide
description: Set slide which was used when generating inputs spectrums. Can be replace, scroll, fullframe or rscroll. Default is fullframe.

parameters.name: win_func
description: Set window function used for resynthesis.

parameters.name: overlap
description: Set window overlap. In range [0, 1]. Default is 1, which means optimal overlap for selected window function will be picked.

parameters.name: orientation
description: Set orientation of input videos. Can be vertical or horizontal. Default is vertical.
Split input into several identical outputs.
asplit works with audio input, split with video.
The filter accepts a single parameter which specifies the number of outputs. If unspecified, it defaults to 2.
name: split

description: Split input into several identical outputs.
asplit works with audio input, split with video.
The filter accepts a single parameter which specifies the number of outputs. If unspecified, it defaults to 2.
name: asplit

description: Receive commands sent through a libzmq client, and forward them to filters in the filtergraph.
zmq and azmq work as a pass-through filters. zmq must be inserted between two video filters, azmq between two audio filters. Both are capable to send messages to any filter type.
To enable these filters you need to install the libzmq library and headers and configure FFmpeg with --enable-libzmq.
For more information about libzmq see:
http://www.zeromq.org/
The zmq and azmq filters work as a libzmq server, which receives messages sent through a network interface defined by the

bind_address (or the abbreviation "b") option. Default value of this option is tcp://localhost:5555. You may want to alter this value to your needs, but do not forget to escape any ’:’ signs (see filtergraph escaping).
The received message must be in the form:
TARGET COMMAND [ARG]

TARGET specifies the target of the command, usually the name of the filter class or a specific filter instance name. The default filter instance name uses the pattern ‘Parsed_<filter_name>_<index>’, but you can override this by using the ‘filter_name@id’ syntax (see Filtergraph syntax).
COMMAND specifies the name of the command for the target filter.
ARG is optional and specifies the optional argument list for the given COMMAND.
Upon reception, the message is processed and the corresponding command is injected into the filtergraph. Depending on the result, the filter will send a reply to the client, adopting the format:
ERROR_CODE ERROR_REASON
MESSAGE
MESSAGE is optional.
name: zmq

description: Receive commands sent through a libzmq client, and forward them to filters in the filtergraph.
zmq and azmq work as a pass-through filters. zmq must be inserted between two video filters, azmq between two audio filters. Both are capable to send messages to any filter type.
To enable these filters you need to install the libzmq library and headers and configure FFmpeg with --enable-libzmq.
For more information about libzmq see:
http://www.zeromq.org/
The zmq and azmq filters work as a libzmq server, which receives messages sent through a network interface defined by the

bind_address (or the abbreviation "b") option. Default value of this option is tcp://localhost:5555. You may want to alter this value to your needs, but do not forget to escape any ’:’ signs (see filtergraph escaping).
The received message must be in the form:

TARGET specifies the target of the command, usually the name of the filter class or a specific filter instance name. The default filter instance name uses the pattern ‘Parsed_<filter_name>_<index>’, but you can override this by using the ‘filter_name@id’ syntax (see Filtergraph syntax).
COMMAND specifies the name of the command for the target filter.
ARG is optional and specifies the optional argument list for the given COMMAND.
Upon reception, the message is processed and the corresponding command is injected into the filtergraph. Depending on the result, the filter will send a reply to the client, adopting the format:

MESSAGE
MESSAGE is optional.
name: azmq

description: This is the same as movie source, except it selects an audio stream by default.
name: amovie

description: Read audio and/or video stream(s) from a movie container.
It accepts the following parameters:
name: movie

parameters.name: filename
description: The name of the resource to read (not necessarily a file; it can also be a device or a stream accessed through some protocol).

parameters.name: format_name
description: Specifies the format assumed for the movie to read, and can be either the name of a container or an input device. If not specified, the format is guessed from movie_name or by probing.

parameters.name: seek_point
description: Specifies the seek point in seconds. The frames will be output starting from this seek point. The parameter is evaluated with
av_strtod, so the numerical value may be suffixed by an IS postfix. The default value is "0".

parameters.name: streams
description: Specifies the streams to read. Several streams can be specified, separated by "+". The source will then have as many outputs, in the same order. The syntax is explained in the (ffmpeg)"Stream specifiers"
section in the ffmpeg manual. Two special names, "dv" and "da" specify respectively the default (best suited) video and audio stream. Default is "dv", or "da" if the filter is called as "amovie".

parameters.name: stream_index
description: Specifies the index of the video stream to read. If the value is -1, the most suitable video stream will be automatically selected. The default value is "-1". Deprecated. If the filter is called "amovie", it will select audio instead of video.

parameters.name: loop
description: Specifies how many times to read the stream in sequence. If the value is 0, the stream will be looped infinitely. Default value is "1".
Note that when the movie is looped the source timestamps are not changed, so it will generate non monotonically increasing timestamps.

parameters.name: discontinuity
description: Specifies the time difference between frames above which the point is considered a timestamp discontinuity which is removed by adjusting the later timestamps.
